notes: On 25 Feb 2020, police arrested three land rights activists in Kisalanda village near Kakwoko (Kiryandongo district), transferring them to prison, where they were tortured. Upon their release on bail on 12 March, their houses were bulldozed.
On 25 February 2020, a man (who was accused of sexually assaulting an underage girl) was killed by a lynch mob in Mungaaro village in Bubaare subcounty (Rubanda district). [size=no report]

On 24 February 2020, People Power supporters clashed with police in Ndeeba, after police prevented them from holding a meeting. Tires were burned by the PP supporters, whilst police used tear gas and live rounds against the demonstrators, and arrested six. [size=at least 6]

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
notes: On 24 February 2020, police and LDU paramilitaries fired tear gas at FDC supporters holding a political rally in Njeru (Buikwe district). [size=no report]

On 24 February 2020, police fired tear gas and live rounds (assumed aerial fire) in Kabale town (Kabale district) at People Power supporters participating in a rally, held amidst student elections at the University in Kabale. [size=no report]

On 23 February 2020, a lynch mob comprising of boda boda drivers (and possibly others) attempted to kill a suspected thief in Kakumiro town (Kakumiro district). Police intervened and opened fire, hitting three (including another police officer) with live rounds, including a student who died from their injuries. [size=no report]
On 23 February 2020, Christian protesters marched in Kumi (Kumi district), amidst a dispute over elections for the position of Bishop in the area. [size=no report]

On 23 February 2020, Christian protesters marched in Ngora (Ngora district), amidst a dispute over elections for the position of Bishop in the area. Police arrested over 30 demonstrators. [size=at least 30]

On 20 February 2020, a 'scuffle' broke out between the supporters of an academic and police outside of a courthouse in Kampala, following the quashing of her conviction for insulting the President. Live rounds were fired into the air to disperse the crowd. [size=no report]

On 20 February 2020, over 60 residents of rural areas around Njeru demonstrated in Njeru town (Buikwe district), calling for compensation after a private company damaged property and crops in their villages. [size=over 60]

On 19 February 2020, students rioted at Kigezi College in Kabale town (Kabale district), after a student was suspended for extorting other students. His colleagues threw stones at teachers and damaged property, before attempting to torch the headteachers' residence. Police used tear gas and fired live rounds into the air to disperse the students. [size=no report]

On 18 February 2020, hundreds of boda boda drivers marched in Kampala claiming that police were harassing them. The demonstrators were blocked by police, leading to clashes. Police used tear gas and live rounds (presumed to be fired into the air) to clear the demonstrators. [size=hundreds]

actor1: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Fisheries Protection Unit
notes: On 16 February 2020, a fisherman was shot dead and another wounded by a UPDF Fisheries patrol near Kisenyi village on Lake Albert (Rubirizi district). The UPDF Fisheries spokesman alleged that the soldiers acted in self-defence, and were being threatened by the fishermen, who were attempted to hit them with their oars.

On 14 February 2020, an Imam was killed by at least four unknown attackers in Busimba in Iwemba subdistrict (Bugiri district). Four people have been arrested; police have accused the ADF rebel group of being involved, although this is not confirmed.

On 14 February 2020, over 500 casual workers from a tungsten mine in Karra parish (Rubanda district) demonstrated following the abrupt closure of the mine by its international owners, which has left many without an income. Police prevented the demonstrators from marching to Rubanda town to lodge their grievances. [size=over 500]

On 14 February 2020, Democratic Party youth protested (and interrupted) at a party meeting which they believed would remove the Party Organising Secretary (supposedly on the grounds that he supported the People Power movement). The demonstration happened in the Mengo area of Kampala. Police were deployed, but did not become involved. [size=no report]

On 13 February 2020, taxi drivers demonstrated in Kabale town (Kabale district) following the decision of the Uganda Road Works Authority to prevent taxi drivers from using part of the road outside of their building. Police used tear gas and live rounds into the air to disperse the demonstrators, who had blocked the roads. [size=no report]

On or before 11 February 2020, parents and students of a primary school in Kasongi in Lugusuulu subcounty (Mawogola, Ssembabule) protested following the unexpected movement of the schools' headteacher to Ntuusi subcounty, calling for authorities to leave the headmaster in place. [size=no report]

On 8 February 2020, truck drivers blocked the Kampala-Masaka road at Lukaya town (Kalungu district), calling for the release of a colleague of theirs who had been arrested for failing to pay a fine related to avoiding weighing station. [size=no report]

On 8 February 2020, taxi drivers demonstrated in Kabale town (Kabale district), following the decision of the Uganda Road Works Authority to prevent taxi drivers from using part of the road outside of their building. [size=no report]

actor1: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
notes: On 7 February 2020, around 30 men armed with pangas (and accompanied by 3 LDU paramilitaries) attacked farmers working on land belonging to a Christian University in Ntaawo (Mukono district), wounding six, and destroying crops and property on the farm. The violence is linked to a land dispute involving a businessman.

actor1: Police Forces of Uganda (1986-) Uganda Wildlife Authority
notes: On 7 February 2020, a civilian from Kapkoros subcounty was shot and wounded by a UWA park ranger after he was discovered (with others) grazing his livestock at an unspecified part of Mt. Elgon National Park (coordinates for Kapkoros, Kongasis county, Bukwo district, used at geoprec2). The UWA have claimed the attack was in self-defence, after the group resisted arrest, and the victim attempted to attack the park ranger (event coded as VAC pending further info).

actor1: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Fisheries Protection Unit
notes: On 7 February 2020, two fishermen were pursued by alleged members of the Fisheries Protection Unit (and who have been coded as such) at an unspecified area near Bussi island (coordinates for Gulwe, Busiro county, Wakiso district, used at geoprec2). Upon apprehending the men, the FPU soldiers cut off their hands. There is no clear motive. Four people have been arrested.

actor2: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
notes: On 7 February 2020, Matheniko fighters shot dead an LDU paramilitary guarding a cattle kraal in the Lapan Namigut area (Napak district), and stole his weapon.

On 6 February 2020, raiders from Karamajong (and coded as such) clashed with a UPDF soldier guarding a kraal at Katabok village in Lokopo subcounty (no geographic information found, coordinates for Napak, Lokopo subcounty, Napak district, used at geoprec2). The soldier was killed and his weapon taken by the raiders.

During the week beginning 3 February 2020, security forces (coded as army) clashed with raiders from Kotido district (coded as Jie militia) at an unspecified location in Kotido district close to the border with Orom subcounty in Kitgum district (coordinates for Lobul, Jie county, Kotido district, used at geoprec2). One cattle raider was killed.

On 5 February 2020, a lynch mob killed a business man linked to the murder of his sister as he was hiding in Butabo cell in Ruhinda subcounty (no geographic information found, coordinates for Mitoma, Ruhinda county, Mitooma district, used at prec2). Police have arrested four in connection with the vigilante action. [size=at least 4]

On 5 February 2020, over 800 teachers from several schools demonstrated during a training event at a school in Iganga town (Iganga district), in protest against unwelcome changes to the curriculum, and against a miserly stipend to cover transport to the school. Police intervened and arrested one teacher. [size=over 800]

On 3 February 2020, residents of Odolo village in Morulem subcounty barricaded a road in Rackoko parish (no geographic information found, coordinates for Morulem town, Abim district, used at geoprec2), after their area was once again excluded from road improvement works, and amidst allegations that the engineer in charge of the project was profiting from selling materials required for the road. The demonstration lasted at least three days. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-); Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit; Private Security Forces (Uganda)
notes: On 28 January 2020, residents of Kalerwe suburb (Kampala) attacked private security with stones and set up barricades, in demonstration against an operation to shut down illegal electricity connections. Police, UPDF, and LDUs (who had accompanied the private security) were also present, and police (coded as actor1) used tear gas to disperse the crowds. [size=no report]
On 27 January 2020, FDC supporters were prevented by riot police from holding a rally in Muhanga (Rukiga district). [size=no report]

On 27 January 2020, members of the Koki clan of the Acholi attacked Kalabong (Kitgum district), in a revenge attack directed at members of the Yom clan following the killing of a Koki teenager several days before. The source does not mention whether anyone was injured, and instead notes that property was vandalised and looted.
On 27 January 2020, FDC supporters were prevented by riot police from holding a rally in Rubanda town (Rubanda district). [size=no report]

On 24 January 2020, a man was injured by unexploded ordnance (likely left from fighting between the UPDF and LRA) in Wilul village in Paicho sub-county (coordinates for Paicho, Aswa county, Gulu district, used at geoprec2).

assoc_actor_1: FDC: Forum for Democratic Change; Civilians (Uganda); Journalists (Uganda)
notes: On 22 January 2020, FDC supporters clashed with police in Jinja (Jinja district) during a rally in the town, whilst the ex-FDC leader was arrested (alongside a journalists who was conducting a radio interview with the ex-leader). [size=no report]
On 20 January 2020, FDC supporters marched in Jinja (Jinja district), but were dispersed by police, who beat an unspecified number of supporters in Masese III slum. [size=no report]

On 20 January 2020, FDC supporters marched in Mbale town (Mbale district) in a belated celebration of the 15 year anniversary of the formation of the party, but were intercepted by police, who also arrested the FDC party chairman. [size=no report]

On 20 January 2020, Turkana cattle raiders attacked Kamour village in Panyangara sub-county (coordinates for Panyangara, Jie county, Kotido district, used at geoprec2), and clashed with UPDF soldiers stationed at the village to prevent raiding. In the crossfire, four pastoralist teenagers were killed (one of whom died at a hospital having been injured in the gunfire).

On 20 January 2020, FDC supporters marched in Soroti town (Soroti district), but were intercepted by police. FDC supporters threw stones at the police and burned tires in the roads, before police (and UPDF reinforcements) dispersed the crowd with tear gas and beatings, wounding three (including a six-month old child). Two police officers have been arrested. [size=no report]

On 15 January 2020, four youths attacked the speaker of the Ntungamo district assembly at Ntungamo town (Ntungamo district) with pepper spray. The incident is reportedly linked to the speaker's intention to contest a seat of a former ally in upcoming elections. [size=4]

On 15 January 2020, a mob of boda boda drivers attempted to kill a suspected motorbike thief in Kalerwe (Kampala). Police intervened, and rescued the victim before he could be set alight. [size=no report]

During the month of January 2020, taxi drivers protested at the Kampala Capital City Authority HQ, calling for authorities to enforce recent changes to taxi stands in the city. The drivers say that some taxi drivers are not respecting the changes, which is penalising those who have adhered to them. [size=no report]

On 13 January 2020, two UPDF members guarding a cattle kraal were killed by Turkana fighters at Toruchup in Losilang parish (Kotido district). The attackers then stole the weapons belonging to the soldiers.
On 13 January 2020, anti-corruption activists marched in Kampala. Police intercepted the demonstrators, and arrested 13 organisers. [size=at least 13]

On or after 12 January 2020, members of the Karamajong ethnic group (coded as Karamajong militia) attacked members of the Teso group living in Apeitolim (Napak district), torching 24 dwellings, and killing a small child who was in one of them. The attack is a retaliation for a lynching that took place on 12 Jan. 20 were arrested following the attack.

On 12 January 2020, members of the Teso ethnic group lynched a Karamajong man in Apeitolim (Napak district) after he was spotted sharing a motorbike with the wife of a Teso inhabitant. [size=no report]

As reported on 10 January 2020 (and implied to have occurred recently; time precision 3 used) a mob attacked milk vendors at an unspecified location in Ssembabule district, assaulting the vendors and vandalising their property. A local MP is suspected of organising the mob. [size=no report]

On 10 January 2020, miners marched to Ruhaama (Ntungamo district) from surrounding areas, in protest at alleged abuses by police officers directed towards them, and the low prices paid by a mineral trading firm in the area (which has a monopoly on trade). Police attempted to prevent demonstrators from marching, though were unsuccessful in doing so.[size=400]

On 10 January 2020, pastoralists staged a demonstration in Lwemiyaga (Ssembabule district) in which they attempted to take their cattle to sale at the market, despite a ban due to an outbreak of foot and mouth disease. Police arrested a local MP who organised the demonstration. [size=no report]

actor1: Police Forces of Uganda (1986-) Uganda Wildlife Authority
notes: On or after 8 January 2020, a charcoal burner was killed near Sosomi in Buluganya subcounty (Bulambuli district, coordinates for Buluganya used at geoprec2). UWA - who were conducting operations in the area at the time - are suspected of killing the civilian, and have been coded as actor1.

On 8 January 2020, two UPDF soldiers were stabbed by three Karamajong raiders at a water pump in Nakapelimoru sub-county (Kotido districts). The raiders then stole the weapons of the wounded soldiers.

On or after 7 January 2020, boda boda drivers protested in Mukono town (Mukono district), carrying the body of a colleague (who had been killed after being hit by a commercial taxi) to the police station, and demanding the release of their colleagues who had earlier attempted to mobilise boda drivers for a demonstration. [size=100]

On 7 January 2020, a lynch mob comprising South Sudanese refugees attempted to kill a man suspected of murdering two refugees. A police officer intervened, but one refugee took the officer's weapon and shot the officer dead. The event occurred in Onyire village (Moyo district, coordinates for Logoba used at geoprec2). [size=no report]

On 6 January 2020, People Power supporters demonstrated in Kasangati (Wakiso district) against measures by authorities to prevent Bobi Wine MP from launching Consultative Meetings as part of his Presidential run. Police claimed that the supporters threw stones at police, wounding one officer, and that 'many' were arrested. [size=at least many]

source: Chimp Reports; Daily Monitor (Uganda); URN (Uganda); AP
notes: On 6 January 2020, People Power supporters gathered in Kasangati (Wakiso district) to welcome Bobi Wine MP's run for the presidency. Police blocked the road and arrested Bobi Wine, before firing tear gas and rubber bullets at his supporters (who were reported by police to have blocked roads with wood and tires, and engaged in clashes with police, and have been recorded as rioters pending further information), with one police officer wounded by a stray rubber bullet. (Note that initial reports claiming that an infant had died from inhaling tear gas were incorrect, according to police) [size=no report]

On 6 January 2020, People Power supporters gathered in Gayaza (Wakiso district) for a rally in support of the movement and of Bobi Wine MP's run for the presidency. Police arrested several protesters who refused to vacate the area, and fired tear gas upon the crowd. [size=no report]

actor1: Police Forces of Uganda (1986-) Uganda Wildlife Authority
notes: On or after 6 January 2020, a charcoal burner was killed near Kitsatsa village in Bumayoka subcounty (Bududa district, coordinates for Bufuma used at geoprec2). On 30 December 2019, a lynch mob attempted to kill a suspect bike thief in Mukono town (Mukono district), before attacking a police officer who had come to intervene. Police reinforcements arrived, and dispersed the mob with tear gas and live rounds. [size=no report]

On 29 December 2019, unexploded ordnance (believed to have been from violence dating back to the counter-insurgency against the LRA) detonated in Latigi Parish (Pader district), killing a civilian who had accidentally damaged it whilst gardening.
On 27 December 2019, UPDF clashed with Jie raiders at Loputuk village in Nadunget sub-county (Moroto district, coordinates for Nadunget used at geoprec2), killing one Jie raider.

On 25 December 2019, UPDF clashed with cattle raiders from Kotido district in Rupa sub-county (Moroto district). The source describes two of the raiders as being 'put out of action', and have been coded as fatalities at fatality prec2.
On 25 December 2019, a lynch monb attacked two suspected thieves in Gulu town (Gulu district). Police intervened to save the two suspects. [size=small]

On 25 December 2019, police shot and killed a civilian during an problem at a nightclub in Mukatesani (Rukungiri district, coordinates for Mutozho used at geoprec2). Police have claimed they were attacked by the patrons of the club.
On 24 December 2019, UPDF clashed with Kenyan Pokot raiders near Nakapiripirit town (Nakapiripirit district), killing two Pokot raiders.

actor1: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Fisheries Protection Unit
notes: On 23 December 2019, the UPDF Fisheries force entered Bugulu landing site (Buvuma district, coordinates for Kirongo used at prec2), assaulting residents and confiscating property. The event occurred despite the Ugandan parliament suspending the unit, following multiple incidents in which it abused civilians.

On 21 December 2019, a lynch mob killed two suspected thieves and burned their bodies. The incident occurred in Kitgum (Kitgum district), and one accomplice of the suspect thieves escaped. [size=no report]
On 19 December 2019, UPDF ambushed suspected Matheniko raiders at an unspecified location in Kotido district (coordinates for Kotido town used at geoprec2), killing three and capturing one.

actor2: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Fisheries Protection Unit
notes: On 19 December 2019, the Ugandan parliament has suspended the operations of the UPDF Fisheries Unit, following numerous reports of abuse and torture linked to the Unit. It is unclear how long the suspension will last for.

On 18 December 2019, residents of Hamurwa sub-county marched from Hamuko to Hamurwa (Rubanda district, coordinates used at geoprec2), in opposition to the very poor quality of the road in the area, and the absence of improvements despite the allocation of money for the road. Police prevented the demonstrators from proceeding, although allowed 11 chairpersons of villages to continue the march. [size=500]

On 17 December 2019, demonstrators (coded as rioters) attempted to dig up boundary pillars which had been put on disputed land at Namakole (Mbale district). Riot police fired into the crowd, hitting a civilian who was not involved in the demonstration, and who died of his wounds shortly after. [size=no report]

actor2: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit

actor1: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
notes: On 17 December 2019, an LCIII chairman attempted to prevent Local Defence Unit soldiers from seizing cattle (taken due to allegations they had been rustled). He was then shot dead by an LDU. The incident occurred at Kidepo army barracks (Moroto district).

On 17 December 2019, a lynch mob killed a suspect in a defilement case who had been released on bail in Lopulingi parish (Lamwo district), after he became involved in a brawl with his family. [size=small]
On 16 December 2019, UPDF clashed with Karamajong raiders in Nakapelimoru sub-county (Kotido district, coordinates for Nakapelimoru used at geoprec2), killing three and arresting one.

On 16 December 2019, a mentally ill man with a panga was intercepted by a mob in the village of Namayonjo (Nakasongo district; coordinates for Kisalizi used at geoprec2). The brother of the man intervened and the mob to release him, but a police officer shot the man dead, claiming he had become violent.

On 15 December 2019, members of the Palukere Acholi clan (armed with hand weapons and bows) attacked the Pali Pali Acholi clan in the area of Palukere (Amuru district), setting fire to 52 dwellings and stealing cattle, and displacing 500. A former army officer is linked to the attacks, which are variously described as being linked to a land dispute or for the death of the officer's brother (who may have died during the event, though this is unclear).

Around 15 December 2019 (month of), a lynch mob killed a suspected goat thief in or near Aduku (Kwania district). Seven people were arrested in June 2020 in connection with the killing. [size=at least 7]

On 13 December 2019, market vendors burned tires on the roads at the Kame suburb of Mukono town (Mukono district), in demonstration against the failure of local authorities to re-establish electricity in the area. Police dispersed the demonstrators with tear gas. [size=no report]
On 13 December 2019, police arrested a number of People Power activists as they marched in Makindye (Kampala), and attempted to mobilise residents of the area to join the march. [size=small]

One event coded at Jurumini, Adjumani district, at geoprec2). One Madi man was killed, and around 12 injured (some seriously). Dwellings were also torched, and looting occurred.

source: URN (Uganda); Daily Monitor (Uganda); Eye Radio (South Sudan); Radio Miraya
notes: On 11 December 2019, a Madi militia attacked Dinka refugees at Nyumanzi camp (Adjumani district), after the unexplained death of a Madi civilian in the camp the previous day. In the clashes between the Madi and Dinka, at least one Dinka refugee died (one report says six, though this is not corroborated by others), and injuring around 11 (some seriously, with injuries spread across both groups).

On or before 9 December 2019, UPDF exchanged fire with Kenyan Turkana raiders at an unspecified location in Napak district (coordinates for Napak town used at geoprec3). The raiders fled, and abandoned the cattle they had looted.

On 5 December 2019, casual labourers working for the Ugandan Road Authority protested at the HQ of the authority in Kabale (Kabale district), having been unpaid since May of 2019. The manager of the authority has agreed to pay the workers by the end of the week. [size=30]

assoc_actor_1: Taxi Drivers (Uganda); NRM: National Resistance Movement
notes: On 5 December 2019, protesters (including boda boda drivers) - who are reportedly aligned to the NRM (and coded as such) - demonstrated in Kisenyi (Kampala), against a petition to have Museveni indicted at the International Criminal Court. Police dispersed the protesters. [size=dozens]

On 4 December 2019, police prevented an anti-corruption march by the FDC party (designed to mirror a similar march led by President Museveni) in Mpererwe and surrounding areas of Kampala. Upon intercepting ex-FDC leader Dr Bisigye, FDC youths and police engaged in clashes. [size=no report]

On 1 December 2019, students attacked two men in Rukungiri (Rukungiri district), one of whom was alleged to have stolen clothes from a student dormitory. The students then handed the victims to the police. One of the victims died of his injuries the following day. [size=2]
On 27 November 2019, unemployed men demonstrated in Kampala against corruption and unemployment. Police arrested one protester, who was reported to be in possession of a machete. [size=no report].

On 27 November 2019, a lynch mob killed a local withdoctor after he (and two colleagues) were found at a Catholic shrine in Kazekolere (Burahya district, coordinates for Rutete used at geoprec2). The two colleagues escaped. Police have arrested six people in connection with the attack. [size=small]
On 26 November 2019, road workers protested at the local authority offices at Busia (Busia district), demanding salary arrears to be paid. [size=no report]

On 26 November 2019, protesters gathered in Kabowa (Kampala) to protest the closure of a footpath by a factor owner. A police officer fired several rounds at the protesters, shooting a demonstrator in the head, and killing him. The officer has been arrested. [size=no report]

On November 23, 2019, taxi drivers blocked roads with their vehicles in Nansana (Wakiso district) in protest at the presence of a rival group of taxi drivers who have recently been moved to a nearby taxi stage. [size=no report]

On November 21, 2019, police dispersed Bobi Wine's People Power supporters with tear gas as they marched at the funeral of Human Rights Commissioner Haj Muhammad Kaggwa (known by his alias of Med Kaggwa) at Lufaka village on the outskirts of Mpigi town (Mpigi district, coordinates for Mpigi used at prec2). On November 19, 2019, striking workers at the Bidco industrial plant in Masese (Jinja district) demonstrated, against poor working conditions, unpaid overtime, arbitrary taxation from the company, and job insecurity. [size=1000]

On November 12, 2019, a mob of parents attacked a primary school teacher at Lacor (Pader district, coordinates for Atanga used at prec2), after he had repeatedly showed up at work drunk. Police intervened and took the teacher into custody. [size=small]

On November 4, 2019, journalists demonstrated in Kampala against infringements against press freedom by Ugandan security organs. Police beat several journalists and arrested one. [size=small]

On November 4, 2019, FDC supporters held a demonstration in Kireka (Wakiso district). Police used tear gas and water cannons against supporters. Video footage emerged of police smashing the vehicle of former FDC leader Dr Kizza Besigye and threatening its inhabitants with a firearm, before filling the vehicle with pepper spray. Dr Besigye was arrested, along with a number of his aides; eight FDC supporters were later arrested. [size=large]

On November 1, 2019, two police officers beat a civilian with batons and threatened to kill him, before robbing him, in or near Ruhaama town (Ntungamo district). The attack comes amidst a spate of similar attacks by police on residents of the area.
On November 1st, police arrested student demonstrators at Gulu University (Gulu district) who were protesting in solidarity with colleagues at Makerere University. [size=70]

On November 1, 2019, Balaalo pastoralists attacked three civilians (including an LC1 chairman) at Alinyiri village (Arua district, coordinates for Rigbo used at geoprec2). The attack appears to relate to disputes over access by the Balaalo to land in the area.

The politicians are accused of mobilising a mob to clear a witch doctor off land in the area. [size=hundreds]

On October 30th, protesters gathered at Makerere Univeristy (Kampala) as part of continued protests against a cumulative fees increase. Police used tear gas and live rounds to disperse the students. [size=no report]

On October 30th, police fired tear gas inside a student dormitory in Makerere neighbourhood (Kampala), after its residents began whistling at them. The police then fired at journalists covering the events.

On October 29th, police fired tear gas against journalists covering protests at Markerere University (Kampala), and arrested three.

On October 29th, students gathered at Markerere University (Kampala), as part of sustained demonstration against a cumulative fee increase. Police fired tear gas against demonstrators. [size=no report]

Two events coded at time prec2, with fatality assigned to first day.

On or around the weekend of October 26th-27th, Kenyan Turkana raiders attacked areas around Nakapelimoru (Kotido district), killing one 14 year-old boy, and abducting a 12 year-old boy. The attackers looted 2,000 head of cattle and hundreds of sheep and goats, and displaced hundreds of Karamojong civilians. The attacks come amidst a spate of raids in Kotido. Two events coded at time prec2, with fatality assigned to first day.

On October 25th, 2019, demonstrators gathered on Saaka road in Fort Portal (Kabarole district), in protest at the poor condition of the road. Demonstrators blocked the road with rocks, logs, and dug trenches. [size=no report]

actor1: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On October 25th, Congolese militiamen in army fatigues (suspected of belonging to the Lendu ethnic group, and coded as such) attacked a group of Ugandan fishermen at Kaiso landing site close to Tonya (Hoima district, coordinates used), attempting to rob them, and killing three.

source: Weekly Observer; Daily Monitor (Uganda); URN (Uganda); Chimp Reports
notes: On October 25th, 15 journalists covering a student press conference (which was addressing the unrest at Mekerere University over the previous three days) were beaten and had tear gas fired upon them by police forces at Makerere University (Kampala).

On October 24th, men in police and army uniforms (and coded as such) attacked Gazi market in the dispute Apaa area (Adjumani district, coordinates for Apaa used at prec2). The attackers destroyed market stalls, fired live rounds, and arrested 2. 2 people are also reported to be missing.

On October 24th, a People Power activist was beaten unconscious and abducted by an unknown group of men in Kamwokya (Kampala). She was held for four days (during which time she was interrogated on her political activities), and released in Kawempe.

source: Weekly Observer; Daily Monitor (Uganda); Chimp Reports; URN (Uganda)
notes: From October 22nd-24th, 2019, students demonstrated at Makerere University (Kampala), over the introduction of a cumulative tuition fee increase. UPDF and police used tear gas and live rounds against protests, with reports of beatings and arrests across the three days. [size=large]

source: Chimp Reports; Weekly Observer; URN (Uganda); Daily Monitor (Uganda)
notes: From October 22nd-24th, 2019, students demonstrated at Makerere University (Kampala), over the introduction of a cumulative tuition fee increase. UPDF and police used tear gas and live rounds against protests, with 100 students arrested and beaten on the second day of protests. [size=large]

source: URN (Uganda); Daily Monitor (Uganda); Weekly Observer; Chimp Reports
notes: From October 22nd-24th, 2019, students demonstrated at Makerere University (Kampala), over the introduction of a cumulative tuition fee increase. UPDF and police used tear gas and live rounds against protests, with reports of beatings and arrests across the three days. Several students were also arrested as they attempted to march to President Museveni's state house. [size=large]
On October 22nd, 2019, student protesters (led by women) demonstrated at Wandegeya police station (Kampala), following the arrest of student demonstrators that same day. [size=no report]

On October 18th, a lynch mob (including boda boda drivers) killed a suspected motorcycle thief in Luwero town (Luwero district) and torched the body. Another suspect fled from the crowd and took shelter at a nearby police station, which the mob then attempted to storm, before being dispersed by tear gas fired by police. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_2: Government of Uganda (1986-); Police Forces of Uganda (1986-)
notes: On October 18th, residents of Kayabwe brawled with local politicians at a meeting in Kayabwe (Mpigi district), following disagreements on local security and administrative issues. Police intervened to stop the fighting. [size=small]
On or around October 17th, residents blocked the Busajjabwakuba road in Nakaloke (Mbale district), protesting the poor condition of the road. [size=no report]

On October 14th, vendors blocked a road in Masaka town (Maska district) with burning logs, to demonstrate against the poor quality of the road (which diverted waste water into their stalls). Police used tear gas and live rounds to disperse the riots. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: Vigilante Group (Uganda); Taxi Drivers (Uganda); Military Forces of Uganda (1986-)
notes: On October 14th, a mob (which included a UPDF sergeant, and boda boda drivers) attacked a suspected thief in the Nakawa division of Kampala. Police intervened to rescue the victim, and used live rounds to disperse the mob. The victim later died of his injuries. [size=small]

On October 11th, a plain-clothes police officer was tied up by a mob who then threatened to lynch them, after he ordered them to vacate an area of land in the area of Lwanyonyi-Kiringira (Mukono district, coordinates for Lukojjo used at prec2). The officer was saved after intervention from the land owner. The incident occurs amidst a land dispute involving eviction. [size=small]
On October 11th, a lynch mob killed two suspected thieves in Mpigi town (Mpigi district). [size=small]

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Uganda (1986-); Private Security Forces (Uganda)
notes: On or before October 9th, a Chinese businessman was rescued from a lynch mob in Kampala, after his bodyguard had shot and wounded a market vendor who had repeatedly protested against the businessman's parking of a truck outside of his workplace. [size=no report]
On October 5th, a mob attacked a suspected group of kidnappers outside a bar in Kampala, beating one of the alleged criminals unconscious. [size=small]
On October 5th, taxi drivers drove from Kanungu to Kabale (Kabale district, coordinates used), in protest at the lack of security along the road. [size=no report]

On October 3rd, police fired tear gas to disperse students at Kyambogo Univerity (Kampala), as part of an intra-student protest which centred upon an attempt to impeach the president of the student guild. The details are unclear. [size=no report]

On October 1st, demonstrators blocked a highway with rocks and burned tires at Itojo trading centre (Ntungamo district, coordinates for Nyongozi used at prec2), following a spate of murders in the area. Police and UPDF dispersed the crowds with tear gas and live rounds. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Uganda (1986-); Labour Group (Uganda)
notes: On September 30th, demonstrators attacked a truck carrying charcoal at Awach (Gulu district), and reportedly attempted to kill the eight occupants of the truck and set the vehicle on fire. Police used live rounds to disperse the crowds. [size=300]

On September 30th, medical students from Busitema University demonstrated in Mbale (Mbale district), at changes in the internship structure, and a lack of money. Police prevented the demonstrators from continuing their march, on the grounds that they did not have a permit. [size=no report]

On September 30th, a lynch mob (including motorcycle taxi drivers) beat a suspected thief in Itojo (Ntungamo district, coordinates for Nyongozi used at prec2), who was rescued by police and taken to Itojo hospital. The mob broke into the hospital and killed the suspected thief. [size=no report]

On September 30th, medical students demonstrated at Gulu University (Gulu district), in protest at changes in the structure of internships. Police dispersed the demonstrators with tear gas. [size=hundreds]

On September 30th, students rioted at Kasese Youth Polytechnic (Kasese district), smashing windows and furniture in protest at the poor quality of sanitation, and the lack of practical lessons, whilst accusing the principal of corruption. [size=no report]

On September 29th, a mob gathered in Rubabi village (Rukungiri district, coordinates for Nyakageme used at prec2) to avenge the death of a man killed in a fight. The mob attempted to attack the home the father of the suspected killers, and torched three dwellings in the vicinity. Police deployed to prevent the mob from killing their target. [size=no report]
28 September. Residents of Railway village in Layibi protested the bad state of a local road. [size=no report]

actor1: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Military Police
notes: 26 September. The FDC Deputy Secretary General Kaija was arrested by Military Police forces on his way from Kibaire voting station.

On September 25th, vendors protested at the Central Market in Jinja (Jinja district), protesting alleged interference by political and security officials in the running of the market. They prevented the new chairperson from accessing the market. [size=dozens]
24 September. Students of Bukalasa Agricultural College protested in Wobulenzi over poor sanitary conditions at the institute. Police forces used teargas to disperse the crowd. [size=1800]

24 September. Residents of Nyarugugu and a group of refugees from Nakivale got engaged in a street-fight over fishing practices in a local lake (no geo location known, coded as Nakivale). One person killed. [size=no report]
24 September (or around). Police forces prevented FDC supporters and Bobi Wine from passing through Hoima town centre. [size=no report]
On September 24th, Bako Olang militia killed a man at Barayom village (Amolatar district, coordinates for Amolatar used at precision), as part of a land dispute.
23 September. Uber taxi drivers protested poor working conditions at the companies HQ in Kampala. [size=no report]
22 September (or around). Taxi drivers from two rivaling companies got engaged in a street-fight over their taxi parks in Kawempe. 19 people were injured and 25 taxis vandalized. [size=no report)

actor1: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Fisheries Protection Unit
notes: On September 22nd, soldiers from the Fisheries Protection Unit shot at fish traders at an unspecified location between Tooro-Semliki Game Reserve and Karugutu market (coordinates for Mongiro, Bundibygyo district, used at prec2). One was killed in the gunfire, whilst the truck carrying the traders turned over in the pursuit, killing an additional person and wounding 14 others.
21 September (or around). Residents of Mbarara protested the introduction of garbage fees. [size=no report]
21 September (or around). Residents along the Kaliro-Kamuli road protested the bad state of the street. [size=no report]
20 September. Traders protested ongoing road construction works that cut off the access to a market in Kampala. [size=no report]
20 September. Students in Kampala participated in the global climate strike and staged a protest in town. [size=hundreds]
20 September. Demonstrators 2km off Palabek protested a demarcation exercise conducted by National Forestry Authority. [size=no report]
20 September. Residents of Apyeta Parish protested the re-opening of the Aswa River Forest Reserve land by National Forestry Authority. [size=hundreds]

18 September. Police forces used live bullets and teargas to disperse FDC supporters in Hoima who protested the exclusion of their candidate from radio shows. No injuries reported from the protesters. [size=no report]
18 September (or around). Millers in Soroti protested the poor power supply at the UMEME office in town. [size=no report]
18 September. Students at Gulu University protested the bad state of the toilet facilities. [size=no report]
17 September. Residents of Bulambuli district protested the bad state of the Buyaga-Buluganya road. [size=no report]

On September 17th, demonstrators blocked roads at Iriiri (Napak district), throwing stones at vehicles, in a bid to stop construction workers entering the town, following news that the size of the road under construction for the town was to be reduced. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: Refugees/IDPs (South Sudan); Gawaar Nuer Ethnic Group (South Sudan)
assoc_actor_2: Refugees/IDPs (South Sudan); Laak Nuer Ethnic Group (South Sudan)
notes: On September 16th, Gawaar and Laak Nuer refugees clashed at Kiryandongo refugee camp (Kiryandongo district), following an illigitimate pregnancy. The Laak Nuer leader in the camp was killed, and a camp court official also died. Police intervened. [size=large]

On September 16th, motorcycle taxi drivers protested the killings of their colleagues over the past weeks and stormed shops in Kasambya (Mubende district). Police and Military forces used teargas and live ammunition to control the crowd. One taxi driver was shot and injured. [size=no report]

On September 16th, protesters aligned to a candidate seeking to be elected as Bunyole cutural leader demonstrated at Butaleja town (Butaleja district), claiming that his opponent was not from the area, and was therefore ineligible to run. [size=no report]

On September 15th, a South Sudanese journalist was abducted in Kampala, and beaten by four men (two of who the reporter said appeared to be Ugandan, and two South Sudanese). The journalist escaped during the attack.

On or before September 10th, residents of Alim village in Pukor parish (Pader district, approximates coordinates based on online mapping service used at prec2) protested against the unexpected arrival of cattle and pastoralists in the area. [size=no report]

On September 9th, street children rioted in Jinja (Jinja district) after the shelter they had been using was dismantled by police. The children torched various market stalls in the area. Police dispersed the rioters with tear gas, and made 20 arrests. [size=80]

On September 9th, students of Hoima Nursing School (Hoima district) demonstrated against the quality of the school and the dismissal of staff by the principal, throwing stones at anyone who approached the school buildings. [size=no report]

On September 7th, a mob beat and robbed a police superintendent (who was not acting in his capacity as a police officer, and coded as a civilian) at Parajwoki (Hoima district), as part of a land dispite in the area. Eight people have been arrested. [size=8]

On September 7, 2019, police intercepted an FDC rally in Mbale town (Mbale district), dispersing protesters with tear gas and live rounds, and arresting four (including a senior member). [size=no report]

On or before September 2nd, police rescued an alleged sorcerer from his house in Kginga, Mukono after a mob had formed outside. When police attempted to escort the man from the building the crowd advanced upon him, prompting police to disperse the crowd with live rounds. [size=no report]

On 1 September 2019, an NGO worker was attacked by an unknown group outside his house in Bweyale town (Kiryandongo district), and died of his wounds (inflicted by bladed weapons) the following day. The source notes that the victim had been lured outside by somebody impersonating his friend.

On September 1st, attendees of a music festival in Mpatta, Mukono turned violent after an advertised performer did not turn up. A police officer shot and killed a demonstrator during the disturbance, and has since been arrested. [size=no report]
On August 30th, a student suspected of being involved in a robbery at a hotel in Jinja was killed by a mob. [size=small]

On August 29th, two men attacked a man they accused of being an NRM supporter (owing to the yellow beret he had on him) in Kalerwe (Kampala). The assailants drove a nail through both of his hands, attaching the beret to them. The victim has had the nail removed in hospital. It is unclear who the attackers were (coded as UAG).

On August 29th, demonstrators marched to the Bushenyi-Ishaka municipality offices (Beshenyi district) to protest against the sale of land which would see the closure of a pork market. The sale relates to a long-standing land dispute and legal case between local authorities and a businessman. [size=no report]

On or after August 28th, the head of an NGO and a friend were abducted and killed by unknown attackers in the Busega area of Kampala. Initial reports suggested no ransom had been asked for. 10 people have so far been arrested in connection with the attack.

On or around August 27th, a mob gathered to attack a mentally-unstable woman who had allegedly murdered her baby. Police intervened to prevent the mob from killing her, and are investigating the death of the baby. The event occurred in Lukunu village (Luuka district). [size=no report]

On August 26th, students demonstrated at Kabale University at Kitumba (Kabale district), following the decision by the University to considerably increase tuition fees, and to compel students to retake an academic year if they fail a module. Police used tear gas and live rounds to disperse the protesters. [size=200]

On August 23rd, residents of an unspecified location along the road between Jinja and Kamuli in Jinja Municipality (coordinates for Jinja used at prec2) protested against the installation of a mobile phone mast in their village. The residents then attacked 'porters' (presumed to be workers installing the mast) injuring one. [size=no report]

On August 22nd, youth supporters of Bobi Wine MP gathered in Mpenja (Gomba district), upon hearing news that Bobi Wine was returning to the area for a funeral. Police used live rounds and tear gas against protesters, causing several injuries, and unsuccessfully attempted to detain Bobi Wine, who evaded their checkpoints. [size=large]

On August 21st, boda boda drivers blocked a road an unspecified location in Mafubira sub-county (Jinja state, coordinates for Mafubira used at prec2), following the death of a colleague in an accident involving a truck. The demonstrators vandalised the truck, and police used live rounds and tear gas to disperse the crowd. [size=no report]

On August 21st, demonstrators from the West Nile region protested at Arua Park in Kampala, against deaths of high-profile figures from their community in recent years, and calling for extra security for a minister who hails from the area. [size=hundreds]
On August 20th, lorry drivers protested in Busia (Busia district), following the imposition of a new levy and parking fees in the town. [size=no report]

On August 13th, a mob attacked two suspected cattle thieves at Nakitolo village in Tamu (Mityana district, coordinates for Tamu used at prec2). One victim was killed by the mob, though police intervened to save the second. [size=small]

On August 12th, residents of the Bardege suburb of Gulu demonstrated along the road running between Gulu town centre and Bardege, in protest at the very poor condition of the road, and planted crops along it. Demonstrators blocked the road with rocks and tires. Later, the protesters peacefully escorted a local MP along the road to show its poor quality. [size=hundreds]

On August 12th, demonstrators blocked a road at Namakwekwe (Mbale district), in opposition to the high number of road deaths in the area. The demonstrators used burning tires, stones and logs, and were dispersed when police fired tear gas into the crowd. [size=no report]

At an unspecified time after the death of a suspect in police custody on August 9th (and coded for August 10th at time prec2), protesters demonstrated at the police post in Kiwenda (Wakiso district), calling for justice for the victim of suspected police torture. [size=no report]

On August 9th, a suspected thief died in police custody in Kiwenda (Wakiso district), with three police officers accused of torturing him to death (note: the police officers have claimed that the suspect died as a result of a lynch mob). Two officers have been detained, and the third is at large.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
notes: On August 8th, market vendors protested the eviction of street vendors at Kalerwe market (Kampala). Police and LDU intervened, though demonstrators threw stones at the forces after they began to impound merchandise belonging to street vendors. Tear gas was used to disperse the crowds, and four were arrested. [size=no report]

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On August 7th, six armed men believed to be from the DRC (and coded as such) abducted a woman at Kanyashande (Kanungu district, coordinates for Kashesha used at prec2).

On August 7th, residents of Nakabago demonstrated against the placement of a school gate on a path used by residents in part of a land dispute. The residents broke down the iron gates of the school; three demonstrators were arrested. [size=small]

On August 7th, a mob comprised of Uganda and Kenya citizens killed a suspected motorbike thief at Alupe village (Busia district; no geographic information found, coordinates for Busia used at prec3). [size=no report]

On August 7th, a landlord was killed at Minaana village (Mityana district, coordinates for Tamu used at prec2), amidst a land dispute. Six people have been arrested (including the village chairperson), and a number of suspects have left the village.

On August 5th, a soldier attacked a pregnant woman at Maruzi ranch in Ibuje sub-district (Apac district, coordinates for Ibuje used at prec2). The attacker beat the woman after she refused to have sex with him, and he has since been arrested.

On August 4th, Zigy Wyne (the stage name of Michael Kalinda) - a musician and supporter of Bobi Wine MP - died at a hospital in Kampala, having been abducted by unknown men two weeks prior, and being subject to mutilation and torture. Bobi Wine has suggested the death was the work of government authorities, whilst police are treating the case as a murder. (Note: date of death used for the event, given the unclear date of abduction)

On August 2nd, residents of four sub-counties which adjoin Mt Elgon National Park protested at the District HQ in Mbale town (Mbale district), following alleged encorachment by Wildlife Authority rangers onto the land of the sub-counties, which residents fear pressages a withdrawal of their land rights. [size=no report]

During the week commencing July 29th, two men were detained by state security agents at Mutungo (Wakiso district), with the agents shooting one man in the leg after he fled. Police have acknowledged that a 'sister agency' has detained the two men, but have not specified which one (actor1 coded as police pending further information).

On July 31st, a police officer was killed as he slept at the police post in Ayivuni sub-county (Arua district, coordinates for Mingoro used at prec2), by an unknown group who cut him with bladed weapons.

On July 27th, youth (armed with machetes and bows) from Palorinya attacked the vehicle of an MP, before attacking Iboa village (Moyo district, coordinates for Palorinya used at prec2), injuring four, and torching a number of dwellings. The dispute centres around the relocation of the area to the newly created Obongi district.
On July 26th, college students demonstrated in Kitgum (Kitgum district), throwing stones at teachers and damaging school property. [size=no report]

On July 25th, students from two secondary schools in Mbale (Mbale district) clashed following escalating disputes. Police fired teargas at the students, causing 50 hospitalizations, mostly of female students. [size=dozens]

On June 24th, newly unemployed workers at Tembo Steels plant in Iganga town (Iganga district) demonstrated at the steel plant, preventing vehicles from entering or leaving. The dispute relates to the rapid dismissal of workers and salary arrears. [size=168]

On July 24th, a lynch mob (which included boda boda drivers) attacked and killed two men in Kabatanagi cell (Kiruhura, coordinates for Kazo used at prec2). The victims had been accused of stealing a motorbike. [size=small]

On 24 July 2019, Democratic Party members met in Luwero town (Luwero district) to plan for an upcoming rally. Police told the DP members to leave as they did not have a permit, but the members refused on the grounds that it was an internal party event. Police fired tear gas to disperse the members. [size=40]

On July 22nd, a 17 year-old student was killed by a lynch mob of vendors after he was accused of stealing from Rushebeya market (Rukiga district, coordinates for Kitanga town used at prec2). [size=small]

On June 22nd, a Karamajong militia attacked Teso civilians in two villages (Oiselem and Okameta) of Apeitolim parish (Napak state, coordinates used), burning dwellings and displacing between 300-450 residents. There are no reports of injuries. The attacks relate to a tense border dispute on the frontier of Napak.

On July 21st, men armed with spears and machetes were reported to have been attacking residents in Nyakahaama village (Kyenjojo district, coordinates for Ganuinayo used at prec2). The men were allegedly employed by a man who has claimed the land as his own. At least two people were injured in the attacks.

On or around July 17th, armed men from South Sudan (described as a militia in the source, though with some reported to be wearing army uniforms, and recorded as UAG pending further information) occupied various locations in Lokung sub-county (Lamwo district, coordinates for Ngomoromo used at prec2), displacing hundreds of local residents.

On July 16th, supporters of a former journalist and pastor (who was recently arrested) demonstrated at the Special Investigations Unit in Kireka (Wakiso district), demanding his release. [size=40]

On July 15th , followers of a Pastor who runs a Baptist church in Namabasa parish (Mbale district) attacked and wounded two residents. The incident comes amidst accusations by the community that the pastor is engaged in land grabbing, and has organized violence against the community.

On July 15th , residents of Namabasa parish (Mbale district) stormed the headquarters of a controversial Baptist church, throwing stones at worshippers. Police fired tear gas and live rounds to disperse the crowd, wounding two. The event follows an earlier attack by suspected followers of the pastor of the Baptist church, who is accused of land grabbing and using violence against the population. [size=300]

On July 15th, demonstrators (predominantly female activists) protested in Lungujja (Kampala), following offensive remarks made by a controversial Pastor about his wife. Police arrested nine demonstrators. [size=no report]

On or around July 10th, a civilian from the Jie ethnic group was attacked and killed by a Dodoth mob, who accused him of being a cattle thief. The event occurred at Kalongo bridge (Kaabong district, coordinates for Kaabong used at prec2). [size=small]

On September 7th, FDC supporters were dispersed with tear gas and live rounds by police, at a rally in Mbale, Mbale district. Several arrests were also made. [size=no report]

On July 8th, UPDF clashed with armed Karamajong (who had been robbing vehicles) at Kaalale (Kotido district; no geographic information found, coordinates for Rengen used at prec2). Three Karamajong fighters were killed, and two fled.

notes: On July 7th, police and LDU personnel intercepted and fired upon suspected robbers in Katabi (Wakiso district). It transpired that one of two robbers was a senior police officer, who has been arrested and is under investigation.
On July 4th, a mob torched 50 dwellings in Ojemoru village (Soroti district), after a man was killed in a gambling dispute earlier that day. [size=no report]

On July 4th, demonstrators blocked a road in Kigoro (Kasese district, coordinates for Rukoki used at prec2) using rocks, in a demonstration over the failure of the Chinese company undertaking road works to prevent large quantities of dust from affecting residents and shops. On July 3rd, boda boda drivers killed a suspected thief at Nabingo (Wakiso district). [size=small]
On July 3rd, a mob (including boda boda drivers) killed a suspected thief and another in Lukuli (Kampala). [size=dozens]
On July 3rd, traders demonstrated against garbage collection fees in Kampala. Police arrested four traders, for staging an unauthorized demonstration. [size=small]
On July 2nd, NRM youth demonstrated in Jinja (Jinja district), expressing various grievances against senior NRM officials in the city. [size=no report]

At an unspecified time between June 16th and July 17th (July 1st recorded at time prec3) a Jie civilian was killed by a vigilante mob at an unspecified location in Sidok sub-county (Kaabong district, coordinates for Kakamar used at prec2). On July 1st, protesters gathered once more in Mbale (Mbale district), demonstrating against the failure of authorities to address the problems of leaking sewage in the town (note: demonstrators blocked the road, but unclear if intentional). [size=no report]

On June 28th-29th, police and UPDF clashed with students in Arua (Arua district), who were attempting to attack rival student teams at a sport event in the town. Tear gas and live rounds were used to disperse the students, who were armed with sticks, and one ringleader was arrested. [size=large]

On June 28th-29th, police and UPDF clashed with students in Arua (Arua district), who were attempting to attack rival student teams at a sport event in the town. Tear gas and live rounds were used to disperse the students, who were armed with sticks, and one ringleader was arrested. [size=large]

On June 27th, a mob hacked a traditional healer to death at Bondu-Alwala village (Pakwach district, coordinates for Alwi used at prec2) and wounded another woman, following the death of a teenager she was giving medical advice to, and burned 15 houses. During the week beginning June 24th, demonstrators gathered in Mbale town (Mbale district), protesting the leaking sewage in the town. Authorities pledged to address the issues raised by the protesters. [size=no report]

On June 26th, members of the Atiak clan attacked Panyigoro clan members in Panyigoro parish (Pakwach district), as part of a historic land dispute. The two groups clashed, and 50 dwellings were torched and 40 head of cattle killed, and three people have gone missing. Eight Atiak youths have been arrested.

On June 25th, a Tanzanian national was kidnapped in or around Nakalinzi village (Kyotara district, coordinates for Mutukula used at prec2). A police officer and soldier have been arrested on suspicion of kidnapping, after they had claimed the ransom from the family.

On June 24th, the chairperson of an NRM activist group was abducted by unknown men (coded as UAG) at Mengo (Kampala), after she called for multiple NRM candidates to contest the 2021 presidential elections. The source indicates she was held for several weeks, and tortured by her captors, before being released on July 19th.
On June 24th, security guards and lorry drivers fought in Mpondwe (Kasese district). Police and military intervened, and shot and wounded three people, one seriously. [size=no report]

notes: On June 24th, LDU soldiers shot and killed two suspected Karamajong cattle thieves dead at an unspecified location in Ngariam sub-county (Katakwi district, coordinates for Nariam used at prec2).

On June 22nd or 23rd, boda boda drivers attacked and killed a suspected thief in Mulago (Kampala). A police officer attempted to rescue the victim, though was initially prevented from doing so. [size=small]
On or after June 22nd, a cattle keeper was killed by suspect Jie raiders at Wii Kweyo (Agago district, coordinates for Lokole used at prec2).

On 21 June 2019, a 7 year-old girl was abducted by suspected members of the Gimara clan of the Kakwa ethnic group at a farm in Anyanga village in Kuluba sub-county (Koboko district),owned by the descendants of a former Ugandan vice-president under Idi Amin. The attackers also damaged property on the farm. The girl has not been found as of April 2020. The abduction is linked to a land dispute.

On June 21st, a suspected cattle rustler from Karamajong was shot dead at an unspecified location in Palam sub-county (Katakwi, coordinates for Alekilek used at prec2). There is no further information, including information on the attackers.

On June 20th, a lynch mob (including Boda Boda drivers) killed a suspected thief and detained two others, after they were accused of robbing a passenger in the taxi they were operating. The event occurred in Matuga (Wakiso district). [size=small]
On June 19th, secondary school students demonstrated at the District HQ in Moyo town (Moyo district), citing a list of grievances against the headteacher of the school. [size=no report]

On June 18th, a UPDF marine killed his officer in Jinja (Jinja district) following an argument, and threatened to shoot four other soldiers if they didn't leave the camp. Military and police surrounded the camp, and the officer shot and killed himself.
On June 16th, cattle raiders shot dead a man and wounded his son at an unspecified location in Sidok subcounty (Kaabong district, coordinates for Kakamar used at prec2).

During the month of July, two workers were shot and injured by unspecified security forces (coded here as police) at the cattle market in Bwera (Kasese district). Authorities were preventing anyone from entering the site, following a political-business dispute.

On June 13th, two groups of residents of Nakatiba and Kasamba landing sites (Kalangala district, coordinates for Mulabana parish used at precision 2) clashed following the discovery of a body of a Nakatiba resident the same day. Police intervened and made a number of arrests. [size=no report]
On or around June 12th, medical students demonstrated at Makerere University, over the failure of the university to pay their allowances to undertake internships. [size=small]

On or around June 11th, Ugandan marine police arrested and tortured a Kenyan fisherman for approximately four days, before releasing him. He was picked up from the disputed Migingo island, and taken to an unspecified location (coordinates for Lolui Island, Namayingo district, used at precision 3).

On June 12th, two units of police clashed in Masanafu (Kampala district), with one police officer shot in a 30 minute shoot-out. The incident was sparked when police from one unit attempted to detain one of their colleagues, apparently in a case of mistaken identity.

On June 9th, students of Kigezi High School attacked students at another school in Kanyakiriro village (Kabale district, coordinates for Kigezi High School used at prec2), leading to a fight with hand weapons that killed one student and seriously wounded four. Police used live rounds to disperse the students, and arrested around 30. [size=dozens]

On June 4th, in Nakasongola, Uganda People's Defense Force Fisheries Protection unit, during an operation against illegal fishing on Lake Kyoga, allegedly beat up a fisherman until he developed complications in the stomach and died the following day. Other people under detention were injured.
On May 30th, a taxi driver was discovered in the girl's dormitory at a secondary school in Kakumiro town (Kaumiro district). Male students were alerted, who beat the man to death. [size=no report]

On May 30th, a mob - allegedly mobilised by local politicians - attacked several dwellings in Forest Ward of Laroo on the outskirts of Gulu (Gulu district, coordinates for Iriaga used at prec2), torching buildings belonging to a local witch doctor. [size=hundreds]

At an unspecified time (implied to be around the end of May), an Imam was killed by a lynch mob in Gembe village (Luwero district, coordinates for Katikamu used at prec2), after being accused of involvement in the kidnapping and killing of a child. [size=no report]

On May 27th, a lynch mob killed two men at or near Kabowa village (Jinja district, coordinates for Budondo used at precision 2), in retaliation for the murder of a resident of Namalemba the previous day. Police attempted (but failed) to disperse the mob with tear gas and live rounds, and arrested three. [size=small]

On May 27th, an MP for Mbale led protesters (including NRM members) on a march in Mbale town (Mbale district), after it was announced that Mbale would not gain city status until 2021. Police intervened, and arrested the MP for organising a protest without approval. [size=no report]

On May 24th, Rwandan soldiers shot two civilians (a Rwandan trader and a Ugandan civilian) in Ugandan territory at Hamisavu Trading Centre in Kamwezi subcounty. The Rwandan was attempting to cross back into Rwanda, but turned round when he saw Rwandan soldiers; the Ugandan was a passerby attempting to help the Rwandan trader. Kigali has disputed Kampala's version of events, claiming the event happened on Rwandan soil, and that soldiers fired following an attack by a group armed with machetes.

On May 24th, youth demonstrated in Mbale town (Mbale district), after it was announced that the town would attain city status until 2021. Police arrested 11 leaders of the protests, and used tear gas to disperse them. [size=no report]

Over the course of several days starting from May 18th, Turkana raiders from Kenya raided Karamajong villages in Kaabong district, in the areas of Kakamar, Lodiko and Kaabong West, killing seven, and stealing 500 head of cattle. (Six events coded at time precision 2 at two per location, with fatalities distributed across the events).

Over the course of several days starting from May 18th, Turkana raiders from Kenya raided Karamajong villages in Kaabong district, in the areas of Kakamar, Lodiko and Kaabong West, killing seven, and stealing 500 head of cattle. (Six events coded at time precision 2 at two per location, with fatalities distributed across the events).

On May 22nd, a UPDF soldier shot and wounded a lawyer (on the knees and arm) in Amolatar town (Amalotar district), after he fled arrest. The lawyer had expressed a desire to run on the People Power ticket for upcoming national elections. The soldier has been arrested.

On or around May 21st, a vigilante group attacked UPDF soldiers (whom they had mistaken for cattle raiders) with bladed weapons in the hills near Mabuye (Luwero district), seriously wounding two soldiers. The soldiers then stripped the attackers naked and beat them, wounding nine.

Over the course of several days starting from May 18th, Turkana raiders from Kenya raided Karamajong villages in Kaabong district, in the areas of Kakamar, Lodiko and Kaabong West, killing seven, and stealing 500 head of cattle. (Six events coded at time precision 2 at two per location, with fatalities distributed across the events).

assoc_actor_2: Acholi Ethnic Group (Uganda); Police Forces of Uganda (1986-)
notes: On May 21st, an Acholi mob armed with hand weapons torched 51 dwellings and threatened other Acholi residents of Kati Kati C village (coordinates for Oitino, Gulu district, used at precision 2), in retaliation for a murder. Police intervened to quell the disorder. [size=no report]

Over the course of several days starting from May 18th, Turkana raiders from Kenya raided Karamajong villages in Kaabong district, in the areas of Kakamar, Lodiko and Kaabong West, killing seven, and stealing 500 head of cattle. (Six events coded at time precision 2 at two per location, with fatalities distributed across the events).

Over the course of several days starting from May 18th, Turkana raiders from Kenya raided Karamajong villages in Kaabong district, in the areas of Kakamar, Lodiko and Kaabong West, killing seven, and stealing 500 head of cattle. (Six events coded at time precision 2 at two per location, with fatalities distributed across the events).

On or before May 18th, residents of Bukoba village were attacked by security guards (linked to a private company, and a local NRM politician) at an unspecified rural area in Nalutuntu sub-county (Mubende district, coordinates for Kyakatebe used at precision 2). The residents (coded as Mubende militia) disarmed two of the security guards. The source notes that one local person died, but is unclear as to whether they died in this incident or prior to this event (one fatality coded).

Over the course of several days starting from May 18th, Turkana raiders from Kenya raided Karamajong villages in Kaabong district, in the areas of Kakamar, Lodiko and Kaabong West, killing seven, and stealing 500 head of cattle. (Six events coded at time precision 2 at two per location, with fatalities distributed across the events).

On May 16th, taxi drivers demonstrated against police harassment in Kabale (Kabale district), briefly blocking a road with their vehicles before a meeting was arranged with the police commander to resolve the issues. [size=no report]

On May 16th, UPDF soldiers arrested at least 50 fishermen at two landing sites south of Amolotar, detaining them at Bangladesh site (Amolotar district, coordinates for Amolatar used at prec2). The soldiers tortured the fisherman over the course of two days, for fishing illegally. A committee is investigating.

On May 15th, demonstrators burned tires in Iganga town (Iganga district), in a protest at the poor condition of the roads. Police dispersed the demonstrators with tear gas and live rounds, and made 11 arrests (including of a local councillor). [size=no report]

On May 15th, demonstrators stormed the offices of the RDC in Kabale (Kabale district), following the arrest of a manager of a local NGO, who was accused of sexual abusing girls in his care. The demonstrators are parents of children who benefit from the NGO's services, and are protesting his innocence. [size=50]

During the month of May 2019, miners protested in or near Ruhaama (Ntungamo district) against abuses by police in the area, and against low prices paid by a monopolistic mineral trading firm. [size=no report]
On May 13th, a lynch mob killed two suspected cattle rustlers at an unspecified location in Arapai sub-county (Soroti district). [size=no report]

On May 10th, a lynch mob stoned a local Imam to death in Gembe village, Katikamu subcounty. The killing followed the abduction and murder of a young child from the village; police had already detained two possible suspects for their own safety, for fear that vigilante action would occur. [size=no report]

actor1: Police Forces of Uganda (1986-) Uganda Wildlife Authority
notes: On May 10th, three poachers clashed with Park Rangers (coded as Wildlife Authority) in Queen Elizabeth National Park, Bunyaruguru subdistrict. In the exchange of fire, a poacher was killed, and his two colleagues fled.

On May 9th, demonstrators barricaded roads in Lokitelebu close to Kotido town (coordinates used at precision 2), following the arrest of 18 women in connection with the killing of a suspected witch. Police used tear gas and live ammunition against the demonstrators, with a stray bullet hitting and killing a woman. [size=no report]

On May 8th, students from the Mbarara University of Science and Technology demonstrated in Mbarara town (Mbarara district), calling for local authorities to intervene in the ongoing strike by academics at the institute. Seven students were arrested by police for holding an unauthorised demonstration. [size=no report]

On May 8th, clashes occurred between Jupacelo and Jupada clan militias at an unspecified location in Akaa subcounty. Three people were wounded, 200 people displaced, and 25 houses torched. The details of the attack are unclear, but the incident relates to a land dispute between the two clans.

On May 7th, police and UPDF used tear gas to clear FDC supported in Lugazi town, after they refused to leave the area. Authorities were attempted to prevent FDC senior politician Dr Kizza Besigye from attending a party meeting in the town, and escorted him back to Kampala. [size=no report]

On May 6th, a lynch mob formed outside the police station in Alemi, Ayer subcountyand attempted to execute two suspected cattle raiders who had been rescued from the mob by police earlier that day. Police fired tear gas and live rounds to disperse the vigilantes, who responded by burning down the police station and setting fire to two motobikes. 13 suspects have been arrested, ten are at large. [size=dozens]

On May 5th, the Hoima District Police Commander and his team of police intervened to prevent a mob of Boda Boda drivers (motorcycle taxi drivers) from killing a suspected motorbike thief. The mob turned against the police, throwing stones, prompting the police to call for army and riot police back-up, who resuced the officers. The suspected thief died of his injuries. [size=no report]

On or before May 3rd, vendors attempted to prevent their evicition from the Amber Garden market in Jinja (Jinja district), lighting a fire in the main road to block traffic, and throwing stones at police attempting to enforce the eviction. Police fired tear gas and live ammunition to disperse the crowds. [size=no report]

On May 2nd, court bailiffs attempted to evict mechanics from two roads in Hoima town (Hoima district), following their refusal to relocate to a different area of the town (officials say the oil waste from their repairs is degrading the road). The mechanics threw stones at the bailiffs, promting riot police to use tear gas and live ammunition to disperse the mechanics. There are no reports of injuries. [size=300]
On May 1st, market vendors protested against high taxes in Kampala. Police arrested between two and four traders at the demonstration. [size=no report]

On May 1st, supporters of Bobi Wine's People Power movement burnt tires on roads in Jinja (Jinja district), following his imprisonment the previous day. The demonstrations reportedly lasted 30 minutes, and there is no report of intervention by the authorities. [size=no report]

On May 1st, bodygaurds of the MP for Kassanda South constituency shot a civilian (who was employed as a security guard) in the neck at an unspecified location in Kassanda (likely to be Kassanda town, Mubende district, and coded as such, albeit at precision 2). The victim (who was accused of attempting to disarm one of the MP's bodyguards) survived, and is recovering in hospital. Police have summoned the MP.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Military Police
notes: On April 30th, supporters of Bobi Wine's People Power movement demonstrated in several neighbourhoods of Kampala, following his imprisonment the previous day.  Demonstrators burned tires on roads in the areas of Kamwokya and Kalerwe, whilst violent clashes took place in Kisekka market and Nakulabye, involving police and military police, who used tear gas  and live ammunition against demonstrators (who were throwing stones at security forces). At least five people were reported injured (one of whom was hit by a tear gas canister), two of whom were pregnant women. [size=no report]

On April 29th, police clashed with FDC supporters marching in a procession with senior FDC figures Patrick Oboi Amuriat and Dr Kiiza Besigye in Kasese town (Kasese district). Police dispersed the demonstrators with tear gas and live ammunition; FDC supporters retaliated by throwing stones at the police. [size=no report]

actor1: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Fisheries Protection Unit
notes: On April 28th, UPDF soldiers with the Fisheries Protection Unit attempted to confiscate fish at Sebigoro landing site in Nkondo (Hoima, coordinates for Kabwoya used at precision 2). Although details are unclear, soldiers said that the fishermen formed a mob and attempted to attack the soldiers (actor 2 coded as rioters); the soldiers then shot at the fishermen, injuring one in the leg, and arresting a further four. Police are investigating the incident.

On April 28th, around 40 members of the Lugot clan attacked Pakinyi clan members at Lugede village (Lamwo district; coordinates for Rudi Parish used at precision 2). 14 people were wounded in the clashes, which involved hand weapons and bows and arrows. Seven suspects have been arrested, and a number of those involved are still at large. The clashes related to disputed land.

On April 27th or 28th, members of the Anyibi clan raided an unspecified village in Padibe West, in retaliation for an interpersonal dispute which resulted in the death of an Anyibi woman on April 25th. Palwo residents fled the village in advance of the attacks; police intervened and fired live ammunition at the attackers, causing them to flee. 90 head of cattle and other property from the village were looted; an agreement has since been reached between the two clans regarding compensation for the intitial killing.

On April 27th, police and UPDF fired tear gas and live ammunition at FDC supporters who had gathered for a rally in Lira town (Lira district). Security forces had prevented the rally from taking place, alleging that permission had not been obtained (which has been disputed by the FDC), and briefly detained FDC politician Kiiza Besigye. Note that the source described the FDC supporters as a 'rowdy group of youth', though there is no mention of violent activity by the group, who have accordingly been coded as protesters. [size=no report]
24 April. A female rights activist, was hospitalized as a result of a violent assault by a group of police officers in Naguru, Kampala.

On April 24th, youth supporters of Bobi Wine MP protested against his house arrest, in Kamwokya (Kampala). Demonstrators lit tires in the roads, prompting police and UPDF to disperse the demonstrators (note that the method of dispersal is not specified). [size=no report]

On April 22nd, students at Obyen Community Polytechnic Institute (Kitgum district) rioted, accusing the school of failing to provide adequate teaching or access to food and clean water. The students damaged windows, doors, and furniture in the school. Six students have subsequently been arrested by police. [size=small]

On April 22nd, police and UPDF soldiers prevented Bobi Wine MP from holding a concert in Busabala (Wakiso district). Reports indicate that his People Power supporters threw stones at the security services, who used tear gas and water cannons (one report says live ammunition was also used) against the demonstrators. A number of politicians were said to be among the injured (including Bobi Wine, who said his hand was broken by police). Bobi Wine was placed under house arrest, from which he reportedly escaped. [size=no report]

On April 21st, two suspected thieves were seized from police by a vigilante mob in Amuge village (no geographical information found; coordinates for Alito (Kole district) used at precision 2). The suspects were lynched and their bodies set alight. Police are invesitgating the incident. [size=no report]

On April 15th, three men were attacked in Kilyamagunju village in Myanzi sub-county (Mubende district, coordinates for Myanzi used at precision 2) by a mob, who had mistakenly accused them of being thieves. Two of the men died, and one was seriously wounded. Police have arrested three people in connection with the case, including two local officials. [size=small]
