Hundreds of passengers plying the eastern route were stranded at Nakawa Taxi Park following a sit down strike by the taxi drivers.

A murder suspect who was a resident of Ihunga cell, Ikumba Sub County in Ibanda district was lynched by an angry mob. The mob accused Mugisha of being behind the murder of another man. The mob also attacked another suspect and attempted to lynch him over same allegations but he was rescued by police.

Violent clashes between students of St Geralds Secondary school Nyakibaale and Makobore High school Kinyasano in Rukungiri. Police fired tear gas and live bullets in the air and arrested some of the students.
Police in Uganda have arrested at least 53 people including an opposition leader, for demonstrating against a plan to amend the constitution and scrap the presidential age limit.

A total of four people were killed in Napumpum village in Panyangara subcounty in Kotido district in the space of 10 days. Reports indicate that the assailants suspected the victims of being police informers.

The service held at Ssebaanas ancestral home in Luweero district was interrupted by fights between warring factions of the Democratic Party, one that pays allegiance to the party president Norbert Mao and another aligned to Kampala Lord Mayor Erias Lukwago.
Three people carrying a coffin marked with President Yoweri Museveni's name were arrested in Mbarara, after holding the mock funeral procession despite police orders not to gather for a protest.
A physical fight between the two Democratic Party groups was engaged at Ssebaana's vigil, prompting the Makindye Mayor to order police and some DP youths to drive them out of the vicinity.

Four people were killed in a 10-day period in Napumpum village in Panyangara subcounty in Kotido district. Reports indicate that the assailants suspected the victims of being police informers. The attacks started on 2nd July 2017 with two people killed.

Students at St. Marys College Lacor in Amuru district rioted in protest of an impromptu roll-call that was called to identify students who had sneaked out for a night disco across the road. They vandalized school properties in front of the head teacher's office. Police arrested 18.
A student was allegedly shot by a police officer in Rakai District as they dispersed a demonstration following a teacher dismissal. He is recovering at Mulago Hospital.
Residents in Nakaseke District blocked a village road, obstructing Gender minister Janat Mukwaya's convoy, to protest over bad roads in their district.
Police fired bullets and arrested hundreds of supporters of Bobi Wine who were protesting against the rigging of six ballot boxes by NRM's Sitenda Sebalu supporters.
Running battles reported between NRM supporters and police at Kasangati trading centre after the arrest of Bobi Wine - Kyagulanyi.

Three people including two pupils were injured after they were shot by security officers in Mbale District. Shooting happened as the security officers tried to disperse residents who were demonstrating over land.
Police said three commanders shot or caused the death of two suspects accused of selling guns.

At least three students of Kacheera high school in Rakai district have been rushed to Mulago National Referral hospital in critical condition after being shot by police officers during a violent strike. The students earlier pelted stones at teachers at the school to protest the dismissal of a teacher over alleged sexual abuse claims.

Raid: Police raided the Kampala offices of opposition Forum for Democratic Change party twice arresting three party members. The trio remains in detention at the Central Police Station, Kampala but are yet to be charged.
23 June. An activist was shot and killed following an altercation with a commanding officer of the local Uganda People's Defence Forces in Ntoroko.
23 June. Two  employees with Twerwaneho Listeners Club (TLC), who were investigating misuse of public funds, were killed by soldiers forces Ntoroko, Bweramule.

Construction workers laid down their tools on Friday, in protest against non-payment of wages and abuse of their rights. The workers attempted to lynch one of the management. Police officers were deployed in the area to maintain calm.

Gunmen suspected to be members of the South Sudan Liberation Army (SPLA) raided Bari Village in Metu sub-county, Moyo district,also abducted 13 South Sudanese refugees and drove them back to South Sudan.
Kamwema residents raided Kamwema police to arrack suspected livestock thieves. Police fired live bulllets and teargas to disperse the crowd.
Angry residents stormed and torched Runga Police Post in Kigorobya Sub-county, Hoima District following the death of a suspect while in police custody.
A suspect was arrested for allegedly stealing a battery from Runga Landing Site. He died in a Runga police cell under unclear circumstances.

Workers of a Hoima-based businessman, were attacked by residents armed with machetes, spears, bows and arrows, who were protesting his activities on the land that is adjacent to the oil sites in the Albertine graben.
Gun fire and tear gas rocked Kanungu on Thursday as police engaged in running battles with rioting traders and locals who were protesting against constant power outages in the area.

Suspected Madi community armed with arrows and pangas attacked Acholi occupying the contested areas in Apaa that is claimed by both two tribal groups. The death toll reached 9 while some people are still missing and 27 critically injured.
Over 300 workers at Kigezi Highland Tea in Kabale district protested over unpaid wages for the last seventeen months

The decision by the Uganda People's Defence Forces (UPDF) to withdraw 2,700 soldiers from Karamoja sub-region [northeastern Uganda], has raised concern over insecurity from the different tribal groups
Police in Mubende District have started investigations into the source of an object suspected to be a bomb, which injured four children at Kikona-Kyabatagi village in Mubende Municipality on Sunday.
A police officer was injured following a Sunday night armed attack on Okidi police post in Amida sub-county in Kitgum district.
Arrests: Police in Kampala arrested more than 100 suspected machete attackers in the last two weeks. The suspects were arrested from areas of Bwaise, Namugongo, Najjeera, Makindye and Nabweru.

Great Lakes Regional University in Kanungu district has been closed over a violent students strike. The students protested against the requirement of paying Shs 400,000 to cover the cost of each identity card. Police used tear gas and rubber bullets to disperse the students who were armed with stones and clubs.
Hoima Road workers impound equipment over non-payment. The workers threatened to impoundmore equipment unless the company clears their wages worth Shillings 10M.

Residents in Igayaza Trading Centre in Birembo Sub-county, Kakumiro District protested against the proposed diversion of the road. Police from Kakumiro dispersed the few residents who had been incited by some local leaders.

Transport between Luweero and Nakaseke districts got paralyzed on Monday after irate residents set up barricades across the 30km Luweero Butalangu Road that links the headquarters of the two districts.The residents who were protesting against the poor condition of the road, barred travellers from moving along the road.
Police in Masaka District stopped a planned rally in Nyendo-Masaka by Mukono Municipality MP and Masaka Municipality MP without using the usual tactics of firing teargas.
A police officer has been killed and three others injured in Bududa District after they attempted to arrest three soldiers of the Uganda People's Defence Forcers (UPDF).

source: Chimp Reports; Daily Monitor (Uganda); Weekly Observer
notes: Operations of Kotido Chief Magistrate's court hang in balance after unidentified protesters took off with the court keys on Friday. It all started after Kotido chief magistrate, Charles Yeteise fined a businessman Shs 300,000 for transporting a lorry of charcoal from the district without a license. Residents protested when they learnt that the businessman had bought back the impounded charcoal.

Dozens of medical workers at Mbarara Referral Hospital attacked and surrounded the vehicle of Mbarara University Vice Chancellor Celestine Obua protesting nonpayment of their arrears.The VC was leaving the hospital after a soft loan announcement event for construction of a cancer institute.

Four Makerere University students have been arrested at Buganda Road Magistrate's Court where they had gone to attend the hearing of a case against Dr Stella Nyanzi who is charged with computer misuse. The students, donning the Makerere University gowns, said government should release Dr Nyanzi because they are missing her lectures. The students, whose details could not be readily established, were taken to Kampala Central Police Station.

Three people were shot and injured by police at Kyengera trading centre in Wakiso District as taxi operators used live bullets and tear gas to stop taxi operators who operate at Kibuye - Kyengera stage who were demonstrating against what they referred to as oppressive policies imposed on to them by their colleagues.

Police used live bullets and teargas this morning to disperse a group of striking taxi drivers who closed off the Kampala Masaka Road at Busega, while protesting what they call bad policies from their colleagues.The drivers blocked part of the major road near the Kyengera-Busega swamp, parking about 10 taxis right across. This paralyzed for more than 2 hours, traffic coming in and leaving the city.No vehicle was allowed by the angry drivers to pass their road block; not even bodaboda motorcycles.

Police in the eastern Mbale District last Sunday shot and injured three people, who were partaking in a protest against suspected thieves living inside a police barracks. According to AIGP Kasingye, in the heat of the scuffle, a police officer Habib Sunday (SP) opened fire, shot and injured three of the protesters.

Over 15 Makerere University students have been arrested for taking part in the demonstration that took place today morning at the main campus. Students went on strike protesting the failure by the university to release their results for the last semester, failure to issue Identity Cards to first year students and transcripts to graduates. The police fired teargas and rubber bullets to disperse students and by press time the situation was looking a bit calm.

Business in Kitgum town is back to normal following a protest by passengers at Kitgum Bus Park on Wednesday that led to police firing gunshots.The development came when Bus operators woke up and found the park under lock and key after the Kitgum Central Division officials maintained that no bus would be allowed to exit the park without paying a daily levy

Looting: Unknown thugs descended on Sembabule and Buyoga Catholic parishes in Sembabule and Bukomansimbi districts respectively last Sunday and Monday nights, and they allegedly tried to break into priests' houses.

Looting: Unknown thugs descended on Sembabule and Buyoga Catholic parishes in Sembabule and Bukomansimbi districts respectively last Sunday and Monday nights, and they allegedly tried to break into priests' houses.
13 suspects charged with the murder of the late Assistant Inspector General of Police Andrew Felix Kaweesi came to court limping and with signs of torture. They blamed the police.

Buganda Kingdom wants Kigo Prison Primary School relocated.This comes days after Buganda Land Board announced that the school will be relocated to Nakawuka village, a distance of nearly 20km away.But on Thursday, pupils, teachers and some parents held a peaceful protest at the school appealing to the Kabaka to prevail over BLB and spare their school

Rift Valley Railway -RVR workers are protesting nonpayment of their salaries since January this year. The maintenance and rehabilitation workers blocked the railway line at Bukyaye village in Nakalama Sub County in Iganga district since Monday using sticks, tree branches and removed some rails.

Samuel Kalibbala, the LC-I chairman for Kingo village was attacked by unidentified armed group. he offered them Shs 1m but the groups said they were not after his money.He was cut several times and left almost dead. His family rushed him to hospital and he is steadily recovering. Before they attack a village, they drop leaflets listing the people to be 'visited' on a particular night. Sometimes, the leaflets give reasons why those listed are being targeted

Communities in Muhanga Town Council, Kabale District are protesting the increase in the cost of water supplied by National Water and Sewerage Corporation-NWSC.They accuse National Water and Sewerage Corporation of estimating consumption prior to billing adding that often, units reflected on the water bills are always different from the reading on their meters
Residents of Kabale are protesting closure of the operations of Kabale Youth and Elderly Association, a non-government organisation. The organisation has been operational for the last seven years.
DP supporters clashed with police forces outside the Tropic Inn Hotel in Masaka. The police used teargas and live ammunition to clear the crowd that gathered outside the police station.
Machete-wielding gangs invaded Kampala and the surrounding areas of Wakiso and Masaka. A wave of violent attacks on locals has so far claimed at least five lives and left scores more injured
Police killed two thugs in Kyaliwajjala and Kakerenge who are believed to be part of a machete-wielding gang that has been invading Kampala and surrounding areas.
Hundreds of Ugandans protested against Chinese traders and businesses.
Students at Kabale Brainstorm high school rampaged and attacked their cooks as they tried to serve them breakfast and smashed several window panes prompting police to fire teargas to disperse them.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Four Ugandan fishermen have been abducted by suspected Congolese soldiers on Lake Albert in western Uganda. The fishermen were abducted near Kaiso Landing Site after being accused of fishing in DRC waters.
More than 30 armed men attacked the Ngenge Police Station. Police and soldiers exchanged fire with the group for an hour. 1 police officer and 4 attackers were killed in the incident.

Senior three students staged a sit down strike on Tuesday evening at Kabale Brainstrom high school protesting the delay by the school administration to avail them new uniforms. They also accused the administration of 'torturing' during punishment.
Several students from Jinja SS, Jinja Progressive Academy, St Peter's SS and Jinja Modern SS have been involved in street fights that have left some hospitalized.

assoc_actor_2: FDC: Forum for Democratic Change; Students (Uganda)
notes: The FDC candidate for the president of the Makerere Business School Student Guild was attacked and stabbed as he returned from campaigning.

The Rwandan community in Uganda and their friends took part in a Walk to Remember at the Uganda Christian University (UCU), Mukono Uganda.The walk was organised by the students studying at the University and the Rwanda High Commission in Uganda. They carried banners and placards with messages denouncing genocide ideology.

The Buganda Kingdom Finance Officer hired a militia to evict 50 people from Bugabo Village. The militia drove a tractor through people's fields and used machetes to clear the crops and destroy housing. The angry residents set the tractor alight. Police have subsequently arrested 16 of the militia.
Staff at the National Forestry Authority started a strike to protest that they have not yet been paid. They tried to hold the manager hostage.

Students of Busitema University, Arapai campus, barricaded all roads leading to the university and damaged property. Police later dispersed the rioting students after two hours of running battles. The students accused the administration of failing to pay water bills.
Clashes between NRM and FDC supporters at the Kamuli by-election. A man who was caught bribing voters was beaten up by a crowd of people in Kamuli town.
A Ugandan journalist who had spoken out about the arrest of Ugandan activist Stella Nyanzi, was abducted, driven around, and dumped on the road.
Students staged a violent protest to disrupt the Student Guild Elections. Police fired teargas and fought running battles with the rioters.

205 medical interns at Mulago National Referral Hospital and its subordinate hospitals of Kiruddu and Kawempe protested over their three months allowance arrears, paralysing operations at the hospitals.
In Angagura Sub-county, the LCI chairman and his wife were beaten up at their garden in Kalawiny village. They were wearing NRM T-shirts when they were attacked by unidentified persons.

In Atanga Sub-county, the FDC mobiliser in charge of the North and his agent were attacked by suspected NRM supporters. He was severely beaten up in Lacekocot by these individuals who were travelling aboard a tipper lorry.
Five gunmen from South Sudan on Wednesday abducted two South Sudanese nationals in Moyo district. Both of them were South Sudanese who had been living in Moyo Town.
Police fired live ammunition and teargas to disperse a crowd of people who had gathered to receive food aid from FDC officials. 2 people were injured.
Gunmen from South Sudan killed a refugee in the Belameling refugee settlement camp.

A mob of residents attacked 3 people believed to have mugged a member of the community. The police fought the mob to rescue the alleged muggers and arrested them. The crowd then attacked the police station and had to be dispersed with teargas.
Traders at Arua Park held a peaceful demonstration to protest an increase in rent. A private security guard shot at the protesters, killing 1.

Attacks have been reported in Masaka, Lwengo, Bukomansimbi and in Sembabule districts. At least four people were reportedly killed and several others injured in a spate of night attacks that started from as around 10 men armed with crude weapons such as pangas, axes, iron bars and clubs, attacked the villages; hacking the residents.

Attacks have been reported in Masaka, Lwengo, Bukomansimbi and in Sembabule districts. At least four people were reportedly killed and several others injured in a spate of night attacks that started from as around 10 men armed with crude weapons such as pangas, axes, iron bars and clubs, attacked the villages; hacking the residents.

Attacks have been reported in Masaka, Lwengo, Bukomansimbi and in Sembabule districts. At least four people were reportedly killed and several others injured in a spate of night attacks that started from as around 10 men armed with crude weapons such as pangas, axes, iron bars and clubs, attacked the villages; hacking the residents.

Attacks have been reported in Masaka, Lwengo, Bukomansimbi and in Sembabule districts. At least four people were reportedly killed and several others injured in a spate of night attacks that started from as around 10 men armed with crude weapons such as pangas, axes, iron bars and clubs, attacked the villages; hacking the residents.

On the night of 31st March, unknown assailants armed with machetes and pangas attacked Kyabakuza in Masaka breaking into houses and hacking residents. Over 12 families have been attacked by the unknown gang. 6 injured. Affected villages include Gayaza, Mwolo, Kisoso and Kyabakuza.

Unknown assailants armed with machetes and pangas attacked areas in Masaka breaking into houses and hacking residents. Over 12 families have been attacked by the unknown gang. 6 injured. Affected villages include Gayaza, Mwolo, Kisoso and Kyabakuza.

On the night of 31st March, unknown assailants armed with machetes and pangas attacked Kyabakuza in Masaka breaking into houses and hacking residents. Over 12 families have been attacked by the unknown gang. 6 injured. Affected villages include Gayaza, Mwolo, Kisoso and Kyabakuza.
Kamwenge Town Council mayor Mr Byamukama was arrested and drove to Nalufenya detention facility in the eastern Jinja District where he was allegedly tortured.

Forum for Democratic Change (FDC) presidential candidate Rtd. Dr. Colonel Kizza Besigye came under attack in Teso Sub-region as police fired teargas and rubber bullets at his supporters to disperse them.
Clashes between cattle keepers or Basongora and farmers, who are mainly Bakonzo, broke out in Kasese. Over 10 farmers sustained grave injuries.

A peasant farmer was killed an attack in the disputed Apaa Parish, Juka village in Adjumani District and 138 grass thatched huts were torched by the attackers who were wielding clubs, spears, machetes, bows and arrows.
Police spokesman Andrew Felix Kaweesi, his driver and the bodyguard Corporal Kenneth Erau have been shot dead during a shooting near his home in Kampala.
A trader was shot by cops who were dispersing a crowd that wanted to lynch people they suspected to be involved in child sacrifice.
Students held violent protests at Kyambogo University. They destroyed property and police responded with tear gas and rubber bullets.
Fighting erupted in Kisoro when Ugandan soldiers tried to arrest M23 rebels crossing from the DRC into the Mgahinga National Park. A UPDF soldier and an M23 militant were shot dead.
Arrests: The Ugandan military arrested 42 M23 militants.

actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Residents in Busanza heard gunfire between the M23 and DRC military and fled their homes.
750 M23 militants are reported to have escaped this week from Bihanga Military Training Camp.

Police discovered that local residents were plotting to attack Nakivale Refugee Camp over land tensions, so they arrested the ringleaders. The residents broke into a violent demonstration, blocking the road to the refugee camp. The police responded with teargas and bullets. A number of people were arrested.
A crowd of people attacked and tried to lynch a man accused of rape. The police fired shots to disperse the mob.

assoc_actor_2: Kakwa Ethnic Group (Uganda); Yivo Ethnic Group (Uganda)
notes: Galanji villagers attacked Kakwa and Yivo people, beating them, burning their huts, and looting livestock. Close to 60 homesteads have been abandoned, as the people fled to the DRC.
A man was stabbed to death on his way home from Arua town. His village believes that the perpetrators were Kakwa and Yivo who targeted him because he is Galanji.
101 M23 rebels, who had escaped from the Bihanga Military Training School in Uganda, were intercepted on their way to the DRC. They are currently detained at Makenke Barracks.
Workers are demonstrating and striking to protest sexual harassment at a Chinese-owned construction company.

Ugandan police raided a Tabliq Mosque in Kampala. The leaders have alleged that 25 people were brutalised and abducted during the raid. Arms and recording devices were confiscated. The leader of the mosque has also been arrested in relation to Kiggundus assassination.
The Democratic Party chairperson for Rwampara County, Apollo Karibita, was abducted and strangled to death.

153 royal guards belonging to the Rwenzururu kingdom claimed that police officers had tortured them while in detention at Nalufenya prison in Jinja. At least one of the Rwenzururu attack suspects died in detention, although authorities said he had been sickly even before the incarceration.
Arrests: Johnson Thembo Kitsumbire, the Prime Minister of the Rwenzururu kingdom, was arrested
Arrests: FDC leader Kizza Besigye and some of his supporters were teargassed and arrested outside the Jinja Court, where they were observing the trial of the Rwenzururu king
CSOs held a march to protest a proposed bill to exempt MPs from paying taxes
Military forces of Uganda captured Muleju, the leader of Kirumira Mutimu, a militia group accused of attacking civilians in the Rwenzori Mountains.
Arrests: As many as 139 Royal Guards of the Rwenzururu monarch have been arrested, following clashes. The King, Mumbere, has also been arrested.
People were killed in clashes between the Rwenzururu Royal militia and the military
People were killed in clashes between the Rwenzururu Royal militia and the military
People were killed in clashes between the Rwenzururu Royal militia and the military
87 Rwenzururu royal guards and 16 policemen were killed on Nov 27 during an attack by police and the military on the palace compound of the region's cultural institution.
The Royal Guards of the King of Rwenzururu attacked patrolling Ugandan police and military agents, killing 55 (14 police and 41 military). There was heavy fighting.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-); Muslim Group (Uganda)
notes: A Muslim leader who had denounced rebel activity and joined the army, Major Sheikh Mohammed Kiggundu, was ambushed by unidentified armed men on motorcycles. He and his escort were killed.
A Muslim army major and his driver were shot by unidentified assailants driving a boda boda. The police believe that they were targeted as part of a series of murders of Muslim community members.
4 militants from the Rwenzururu Royal Militia were killed when they attacked a police post.
A soldier accused of battlefront infractions in Somalia was held in Makindye barracks, where he was severely tortured.
Makerere students threw stones and fought runnning battles with the police, who fired back with tear gas and live bullets
Protesters attempted to enter the US Embassy at a demonstration to support Trump in Kampala. 2 men were arrested.

When police attempted to evict vendors from the Old Taxi Park, the vendors retaliated violently, throwing stones and assaulting some police officers. The police, in turn, fired bullets into the air and have arrested about 30 vendors.

Police went to the home of Amanya Bukapa Muhindo to arrest him for training youth to attack government forces in election violence, using the group Bakirumira-Mutima. He attacked the police with a machete, so they shot him.
An unidentified militia involved in a land dispute tried again to attack police officers. The police fired live ammunition, killing 1 person
Around 15 October 2016 (month of), unexploded ordnance killed one pastoralist and wounded another at the village of Kimotozi in Kinyogoga sub-county (Nakaseke district).

More than 20 armed men attacked Bukoba Village in Nalutuntu. Many people were injured, many houses were burned, and more than 1000 people were displaced. The police were deployed to calm the situation.
Banyole and Bagwere clashed in the Suni Wetland, between Butaleja and Budaka, over land access. Many people were injured and the police have occupied the Suni Wetland to prevent further clashes.

Residents attempted to lynch 3 brothers who had murdered the fourth brother in a land dispute. The crowd destroyed houses and property and killed more than 20 animals. The police fired teargas and live bullets to disperse the people.
Police fired teargas and live bullets on students protesting badly maintained facilities and the lack of lectures
An ongoing land dispute between rice farmers and Hajji Maliki Koire turned violent when police patrolling the area were attacked by an unidentified militia.
Arrests: Opposition leader Besigye was arrested at the airport when he landed in Uganda
The police apprehended 100 protesters in a gay pride march near Lake Victoria and forced them onto minibuses to Kampala to be questioned at the police station.
A crowd marched to the police station demanding the release of protesters arrested the previous day and were blocked by police and military, who fired bullets in the air and teargas

Police broke up a group of people guarding the grave of the recently deceased bishop and arrested 16 people, prompting the crowd to rampage and destroy church property. The police and military fired shots
The family of deceased bishop Frederick Drandua , a known critic of Musaveni, are attacked and severely injured by UPDF and police.
A group of youth marched to Parliament to protest the age limit bill
Police holding a community meeting were attacked by a group of 20 men. The police opened fire but were overwhelmed. 2 police officers and 5 civilians were killed.
Makerere students protested the poor quality of food in the dining hall
Rioters set the office of the LC5 chairperson alight to protest the construction of prisons and police headquarters in Rukukuuru

Muteesa Royal University students staged a violent strike over poor sanitation at the campus, lack of text books, dilapidated structures and failure to pay lecturers salaries, leading to the closure of the institution. At least 10 students were arrested as a result of the events.
A mob attacked and attempted to lynch prelates led by Archbishop Stanley Ntagali in Ntawo Village, Mukono District, over a disputed piece of land. Police intervened to rescue the group.
Local leaders in Kisoro District led by the State minister for Regional Cooperation marched through the streets of Kisoro Town in protest of the prosecution of Gen Kayihura.
Unknown attackers armed with machetes attacked six families in Kanyika and Kayonja villages in Kitanda Sub-county, Bukomansimbi District, injuring eight people.
Students in Kabale staged a violent strike in protest against the failure by the school to prepare their usual weekend meal. 13 students were arrested.
Legislators raided the Luwero Police station to protest against the lack of willingness by police officers to arrest suspects in an abortion case.

assoc_actor_1: MUTOCDA: Mbarara United Tax Owners Conductors and Drivers Association
notes: Stick wielding men stormed the chambers of Mbarara municipal council accusing councillors of pushing for the cancellation of a taxi park tender by Mbarara Tax Owners, Conductors and Drivers Association, forcing councilors to scamper for their safety. The attackers assaulted and poured water on some councilors before they forced them to seat on the floor, forcing police to intervene.

Violence erupted in Mbarara after the Court ruled out the petition filed by former Rwampara Member of Parliament Vincent Kyamadidi challenging the victory of NRM candidate Charles Ngabirano in the last elections. Kyamadidi supporters hurled insults at the judge and went on rampage, throwing stones at the police and trying to attack Ngabirano, compelling police to shoot in the air to disperse them.
A group of students at Kashaka high school in Bubare sub-county burnt the boys dormitory after management confiscated their phones.

Residents of Buikwe District whose property was destroyed to pave way for the construction of a 74km road between Mukono and Katosi, protested through Katosi Town against delayed compensation by the government. Police intervened to block the demonstration.
Mobilisers from the ruling NRM party staged a demonstration in Mbale to show their support to Gen. Kayihura over his alleged involvement in the beating of opposition FDC supporters.
A group of students at Welden high school in Katete ward, Nyamitanga division, Mbarara municipality, set fire to a school dormitory over unclear reasons. An investigation was opened.

People in Mbarara protested against the government, notably calling for the dismissal of Genral Tumukunde involved in allegations of violence against opposition FDC party supporters. Police intervened to block the demonstration and arrested 8 protesters.

A group of Christians and their parish priest blocked the construction of a trench dug up by a road construction firm on the church land along Bwankosa road in Kabale, vandalizing the culverts holding the drainage channel. Police intervened to call for negotiations between the parties.

Supporters of Inspector General of Police, Gen Kale Kayihura, stormed the Makindye Court in Kampala to disrupt the proceedings against the General on charges of torture against civilians on. They allegedly locked the Courts offices, and threatened the lawyers prosecuting the case, pelting stones at one of them and vandalizing his car. Police intervened to take the lawyers to safety.

More than 200 residents of Busowa Town Board in Bugiri District protested against poor service delivery and the state of affairs at Busoga Health Centre II.The protest was led by the area local council representative.

Supporters of Inspector General of Police, Gen Kale Kayihura, tried to strom the Makindye Court in Kampala to disrupt the proceedings against the General on charges of torture against civilians that were to take place the following day.
09 August. Three LGBT activists were arrested and physically attacked by Ugandan police days after a LGBT protest in Kampala.
Police allegedly broke up a gay pride event at a nightclub in Kampala, arresting and briefly detaining around 20 people. Some said they were slapped or pushed around by officers while in detention.
A Burundian journalist exiled in Uganda was allegedly stabbed by four unidentified attackers, including two suspected fellow Burundians, in Kampala, sustaining severe injuries.

Police arrested eight people following violence that erupted in Jinja after the High court adjourned a case filed by the Prince of Bulamogi chiefdom contesting the legitimacy of the ruler of Busoga Kingdom. The hereditary chief of Bunya Chiefdom, one of the 11 that constitute Busoga Kingdom, Chief Juma Munulo, was last Friday beaten up by a mob for allegedly turning against the Kyabazinga. Other members of the Bulamogi chiefdom were attacked.

Arrests: Police arrested one of the leaders of the youth pressure group Jobless Brotherhood and FDC Youth League spokesperson for the Eastern region as he sought to pitch camp and go on a hunger strike at the Naguru police headquarters, calling for the resignation of the Inspector General of Police over the alleged recent police beatings of FDC supporters.
Three Ugandan military officers were reportedly killed when they recently went to recover stolen animals from Kenyan Turkana pastoralists in Ugandas Kaabong district.

Arrests: Police prevented FDC leader Besigye from advancing on the road and dispersed scores of his supporters who had gathered at the Kibuye roundabout to greet him after a case where he was charged with disobeying lawful orders and malicious damage was dismissed by the Makyindye Court over lack of evidence. Police put Besigye under preventive arrest for disobeying orders.

source: Human Rights Network for Journalists Uganda
notes: A television journalist was reportedly attacked by commercial motorcyclists (Bodaboda riders) as he covered a scuffle between two rival cyclists' associations, sustaining several injuries and losing his property in Nateete suburb of Kampala.

source: Human Rights Network for Journalists Uganda
notes: Two journalists in Iganga district were allegedly battered by the head of the security team of the Busoga Kingdom leader while covering the launch of the inter-county soccer tournament, sustaining head and chest injuries. Iganga District Police Commander intervened to restrain the soldier from doing more harm to the journalists.

Police banned all activities by the Youth for National Salvation pressure group from all areas of Masaka. The group started operating in Masaka in March this year fighting for rule of law, democracy and calling for an end to widespread killings around the country. The ban comes amid fears of an emerging rebel group.

Students at St. Peters Nyarushanje Secondary school in Rukungiri district destroyed school property valued at 15 million shillings to protest against lack of response by the schools administration after several complaints had been filed over an abusive teacher. Six students were later arrested to assist police in the investigation, while the school was closed and students sent home.

assoc_actor_1: MMTVA: Mbizzinya Market Traders and Vendors Association
notes: Traders and vendors from the Mbizzinya Market Traders and Vendors Association protested on the Kampala-Masaka highway in Mpigi District against unfair market dues levied by their leaders.

actor1: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
notes: A suspected breakaway group of the Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army (SPLA) raided Ngomoromo village in Lokung Sub-county, Lamwo District, in a fresh border row, causing at least 20 households to flee their homes. The group set up its base at a former UPDF detachment in the village, claiming ownership of the 11-kilometre piece of land from the South Sudan border to River Limu in Ngomoromo. Six Ugandans were abducted by the rebels in Ngomoromo the following day.

actor1: SPLM-In Opposition: Sudan People's Liberation Movement-In Opposition
notes: A suspected breakaway group of the Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army (SPLA) raided Ngomoromo village in Lokung Sub-county, Lamwo District, in a fresh border row, causing at least 20 households to flee their homes. The group set up its base at a former UPDF detachment in the village, claiming ownership of the 11-kilometre piece of land from the South Sudan border to River Limu in Ngomoromo. Six Ugandans were abducted by the rebels in Ngomoromo the following day.
Farmers in Lira protested against the late distribution of seedlings and other farm inputs, which is affecting the planting process.

Residents staged a protest against land grabing in Luwero, disrupting a meeting between the Buganda Land Board and Luwero Deputy Resident District Commissioner, demanding for his arbitration to stop their eviction.

Police beat supporters of FDC leader Col Kizza Bezigye who had lined Kampala roads to see him as he had just been granted bail after spending two months in prison over treason charges. Ugandas police chief and seven other police commanders were later charged with assault and four were suspended for exercising unnecessary authority. The events were caught on camera and videos and were strongly condemned by the public and human rights organizations.

Police beat supporters of FDC leader Col Kizza Bezigye who had lined Kampala roads to see him as he had just been granted bail after spending two months in prison over treason charges. Five police officers were later charged with assault. The events were caught on camera and videos and were strongly condemned by the public and human rights organizations.

Police fired live bullets and teargas to disperse rioting market vendors from Juba market in Lira municipality who were being evicted, as the leadership says the market is illegal. At least people were shot and injured in the clashes, while 29 pupils were also injured from the teargas. Police arrested Lira District Anti-riot Commander and a Police Constable five days later for deploying forces illegally.

People marched from Nsozi to Kyangwali Sub County headquarters to raise community awareness on the need to conserve the Bugoma tropical forest in Hoima district, Bunyoro sub region. The march was allegedly stopped by Bunyoro kingdom loyalists protesting against the march by blocking advances on the road.

Traffic police and boda boda riders clashed in Bwaise junction of Kampala as the cyclists protested the impounding of their motorcycles in a city-wide week-long operation aimed at restoring discipline and cleaning the industry.

Unidentified students at Mvara Secondary School in Arua district allegedly torched one of the administration blocks, in what is believed to be a continuation of the strike that started a week prior. The school closed following the event.

Supporters of the ruling National Resistance Movement (NRM) marched to the grave of a famous war hero at Kikandwa village in Nakaseke District, protesting against the marginalization of their area by the government.

Arrests: Police arrested and detained opposition Forum for Democratic Change (FDC)s Chief Mobiliser and other activists who had come to Nakawa Chief Magistrate Court to attend FDC leaders Besigye appearance in Court.

Police forces allegedly beat the driver of opposition Forum for Democratic Change (FDC)s Chief Mobiliser as she had come to Nakawa Chief Magistrate Court to attend FDC leaders Besigye appearance in Court, leaving him unconscious and severely injured.

Students destroyed property at the Church of Uganda Vocational Institute in Soroti District, after some of their fellows were punished for having allegedly been found sleeping in the girls dormitory. The Institute temporarily suspended 297 students as a result.
Students at Mvara Secondary School in Arua district staged a violent strike protesting the closure of school dormitories during meal times, destroying property.
Persons with disabilities staged a demonstration in Mbale to protest Ministerial appointment.

Residents of Kole District, led by the ruling National Resistance Movement (NRM) leaders, marched in the town to protest President Musevenis revocation of the appointment of former Kole woman MP and UPC member as Minister of state for Fisheries, over alleged pressure.

Students at Comboni Catholic College in Lira set ablaze the school administration block in protest against poor meals and the schools clothing policy. 35 students were put in custody at Lira Central Police Station in connexion with the event.

Police arrested 23 students from Kigezi College Butobere in Kabale for allegedly attacking students of Kabale Trinity College in a reported revenge act. They assaulted the gatekeeper, forced themselves into the school compound and destroyed property.
Arrests: Police arrested the Moyo FDC Chairperson over his alleged involvement in a plot to overthrow Ugandas government.

Students at Lango College led a violent strike to protest against food schemes and schooling infrastructure, vandalizing school vehicles and destroying the head teachers apartment. The College was temporarily closed, while police arrested 62 students the following day in connexion with the event.

actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Suspected Democratic Republic of Congo soldiers rob Ugandan fishermen on Lake Albert near Sebagoro Landing site in Hoima district, stealing their belongings.
A radio Ssese journalist was killed by a mob in Kagulube village in Mugoye sub-county, Kalangala district, when he attempted to evict squatters from his piece of land.

Students at Lango College led a violent strike to protest against food schemes and schooling infrastructure, vandalizing school vehicles and destroying the head teachers apartment. The College was temporarily closed, while police arrested 62 students the following day in connexion with the event.

Students at Aduku Secondary School led a violent strike to protest against poor meals and the schools clothing policy, significantly damaging property. The school was temporarily closed, while police arrested 34 students in connexion with the event the following day.

Arrests: Police arrested a senior army officer in Katabi, Entebbe, and detained him at the Makindye Military Barracks in Kampala, over his alleged involvement in a plot to overthrow Ugandas government.

source: Weekly Observer; Chimp Reports; Daily Monitor (Uganda)
notes: Unidentified gunmen attacked a police station in Gulu, killing a military and police officer, and injuring at least four police officers and two civilians. The gunmen were reportedly attempting to rescue Ugandas Peoples Congress (UPC) deputy national mobilization secretary who had been held at the station for a week over his alleged role in the attack on a UPDF detach in Lakwana sub-county on 27 May. Fourteen people, among them three junior soldiers, were charged in connection with the attack as well as that of 27 May, and were remanded in August.

Students at Aduku Secondary School led a violent strike to protest against poor meals and the schools clothing policy, significantly damaging property. The school was temporarily closed, while police arrested 34 students in connexion with the event the following day.

Arrests: Police arrested and detained Nakawa division MP from the main opposition Forum for Democratic Change (FDC) party Kabaziguruka, over his alleged involvement in a plot to overthrow Ugandas government.

Arrests: Police arrested Uganda Peoples Congress (OPC) party deputy secretary for mobilisation, Mr Odiya, in Gulu Town over his alleged involvement in the 27 May attack on an army detach in Opit, Gulu district where two people were killed and a number of guns stolen. A week later, he was charged by the Gulu High Court with treason, and on 22 June, UPC president, Mr Otunnu, sued the government to call for his release.
MPs protested at a nationwide address by Ugandan president Museveni to demand the release of opposition Forum for Democratic Change (FDC) leader Besigye.
Arrests: Police reportedly arrested and detained around 30 soldiers, including following a raid in Kyengera, Wakiso District, over suspicion of plotting to overthrow Ugandas government.

A royal guard of the Obusinga bwa Rwenzururu was shot dead by police as he allegedly resisted arrest by police at Bigando, Hima in Kasese district. The incident also left one police officer severely injured.

Clashes between supporters of the ruling NRM candidate and of his independant opponent followed the results of the electoral race for Mayor in Kihihi town council in Kanungu district. Police and soldiers intervened to contain the violence.

Two people were killed and five others severely injured when residents of Abim district attacked villages in Amuria District, at the border point of Morulem sub county, over an increasing land dispute.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Gunmen believed to be from the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) shot dead an Ugandan fisherman over unclear reasons in Dei, Panyimur Sub-county in Nebbi district.

actor2: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Local Defense Unit
notes: On 27 May 2016, unknown gunmen overran an army detach in Opit trading centre, Lakwana Sub-county (Omro District), killing two people (an LDU paramilitary, and a young child), and looting army uniforms and armaments. A firefight broke out between the attackers and soldiers. Fourteen people, among them three junior soldiers, were charged in connection with the attack and a later one in Gulu on 12 June, and were remanded in August.

Police raided the home of a former Internal Security Organization operative who was once accused of trying to assassinate President Museveni. The man was arrested at Namugongo and held at the police station for nine days without being produced in court, and where he was allegedly tortured. He sued the government a few months later in August.

The Forum for Democratic Change (FDC) contestant in the February 18 parliamentary elections was allegedly abducted from his home in the African quarters in Pece division, Gulu municipality. He had contested the election results after he lost against the National Resistance Movement (NRM) opponent.
Over 3,500 people protested against their eviction from the Aller Community Farm in Lira.

assoc_actor_2: FAWE: Forum for African Women Educationists; Teachers (Uganda)
notes: Intruders broke into the offices of the Forum for African Women Educationists (FAWE), stealing material, in a series of break-ins targeting offices of Ugandan civil society groups.
Protesters in Moroto closed a public road, which led police to detain 45 of the demonstrators.

assoc_actor_2: HRAPF: Human Rights Awareness and Promotion Forum
notes: Intruders broke into the offices of the Human Rights Awareness and Promotion Forum (HRAPF), beating the security guard to death, ransacking the offices of the director and the deputy director, and stealing material. This happened as part of a series of break-ins targeting offices of Ugandan civil society groups.

Ugandan traders demonstrated and denied access to Uganda to their Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) counterparts over three days by setting up barricades and lighting fire on the road at the border of Mpondwe-Lhubiriha town council in Kasese. The standoff ended when police intervened on the third day. Tensions had mounted the week before as DRC traders prevented their Ugandan counterparts to enter over handling of dead Ugandan bodies on the DRC side. The border was closed for three days following the events.

actor2: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) soldiers allegedly ambushed and shot dead four Uganda police officers in Ntoroko District on Lake Albert as the police officers were responding to an illegal fishing incident at Mulango. Three days later, the Ugandan government threatened to use military force against DRC forces if attacks on its citizens on Ugandan soil ever re-occured.

Ugandan traders demonstrated and denied access to Uganda to their Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) counterparts over three days by setting up barricades and lighting fire on the road at the border of Mpondwe-Lhubiriha town council in Kasese. The standoff ended when police intervened on the third day. Tensions had mounted the week before as DRC traders prevented their Ugandan counterparts to enter over handling of dead Ugandan bodies on the DRC side. The border was closed for three days following the events.

Ugandan traders demonstrated and denied access to Uganda to their Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) counterparts over three days by setting up barricades and lighting fire on the road at the border of Mpondwe-Lhubiriha town council in Kasese. The standoff ended when police intervened on the third day. Tensions had mounted the week before as DRC traders prevented their Ugandan counterparts to enter over handling of dead Ugandan bodies on the DRC side. The border was closed for three days following the events.
Unidentified gunmen abducted 20 people from the north-western Yumbe District, bordering South Sudan, and pillaged a village in Moyo district, stealing cattle and food.

One prisoner was reportedly killed last night in a fight that ensued in a Moroto Government Prison cell where Forum for Democratic Change former Presidential Candidate Col Kizza Besigye is being held. The opposition politician revealed today that a gruesome brawl broke out amongst the inmates who were excited to see him, and it ended tragically with one of them being beaten to death.

Forum for Democratic Change (FDC) supporters camped at the Moroto police station entrance waiting for their party leader Kizza Besigye to come out. Police attempted to disperse them, leading to a scuffle.

Gulu University students went on a strike and set their main hall on fire to protest against the late delivery of exam results for the last semester. Police intervened and fired tear gas and bullets to disperse the students. Over 1,000 were later suspended by the school staff.

assoc_actor_2: FDC: Forum for Democratic Change; Women (Uganda)
notes: Unidentified assailants kidnapped opposition Forum for Democratic Change (FDC) Vice Chairperson for youth after attending prayers in Kampala. She was found on 23 May. She suffered serious injuries while she was held by the group.

Arrests: Police arrested former Forum for Democratic Change (FDC) presidential candidate Kizza Bezigye in Kampala for allegedly holding an unlawful swearing-in. Two days later, he was charged with treason over his public attacks on the legitimacy of President Museveni, jailed in Moroto prison and later transferred to Luzira prison in Kampala. Besigye was granted bail two months later, on 12 July. During the same week police arrested FDC party Secretary for mobilisation at Gayaza Trading Centre in Kampala over her alleged involvement in a number of crimes - she was released two days later. Police also put the home of various FDC leaders under siege in Kampala, Najanankumbi and Kira municipality ahead of the swearing in of President Museveni.
Police and soldiers allegedly beat people, including journalists, in Kampala, ahead of the inauguration of President Museveni the following day.
Police arrested 20 people for holding unlawful demonstrations in Kanungu against the delayed construction of the Rukungiri-Kanungu road. They were part of a group of 150 protestors.

assoc_actor_2: FDC: Forum for Democratic Change; Journalists (Uganda)
notes: Forum for Democratic Change (FDC) supporters protested over the disputed presidential elections in Bushenyi. Police arrested a journalist covering the protest.

Arrests: Police arrested the Kabarole district Forum for Democratic Change (FDC) Chairperson in Fort Portal in the context of a nationwide call by the party for protests to review the last February presidential elections disputed results.

assoc_actor_2: FDC: Forum for Democratic Change; Students (Uganda)
notes: Ugandan police and military forces clashed with Forum for Democratic Change (FDC) supporters in Kampala city centre and suburbs. The FDC youth threw stones at the police and engaged in running battles with government forces. Police fired tear gas and bullets in some areas, and arrested at least 30 FDC supporters and several Kyambogo University students who had joined the protests.

Police raided the opposition Forum for Democratic Change (FDC) party office in Tegwana Parish, Pece Division in Gulu Municipality, as some FDC supporters had gathered to follow a nationwide call for protests against the results of the presidential elections. Several of the supporters fled and stayed in hiding until the next day for fear of being arrested.

Forum for Democratic Change (FDC) supporters protested over the disputed presidential elections in Busia, Kamuli, Kabanda, Kabale, Ntungamo, and Isingiro districts. Several FDC supporters were arrested during these demonstrations

Forum for Democratic Change (FDC) supporters protested over the disputed presidential elections in Busia, Kamuli, Kabanda, Kabale, Ntungamo, and Isingiro districts. Several FDC supporters were arrested during these demonstrations

Forum for Democratic Change (FDC) supporters protested over the disputed presidential elections in Busia, Kamuli, Kabanda, Kabale, Ntungamo, and Isingiro districts. Several FDC supporters were arrested during these demonstrations

Forum for Democratic Change (FDC) supporters protested over the disputed presidential elections in Busia, Kamuli, Kabanda, Kabale, Ntungamo, and Isingiro districts. Several FDC supporters were arrested during these demonstrations

Forum for Democratic Change (FDC) supporters protested over the disputed presidential elections in Busia, Kamuli, Kabanda, Kabale, Ntungamo, and Isingiro districts. Several FDC supporters were arrested during these demonstrations

assoc_actor_2: FDC: Forum for Democratic Change; Government of Uganda (1986-); Journalists (Uganda)
notes: Arrests: Police temporarily arrested 14 Forum for Democratic Change (FDC) supporters, Kampala Lord Mayor Erias Lukwago and two journalists at the FDC head office in Najanankumbi ahead of the parties weekly prayers. Former FDC presidential candidate Besigye was also placed under a renewed house arrest. The move follows a court injunction on defiance activities in the country.
Three police officers were arrested following their killing of the son of a newly elected Kapchorwa Municipality Member of Parliament.
Police fired teargas at demonstrators who were carrying placards and mounting barricades at Kasana trading centre in Luwero.

Uganda Christian University (UCU) students demonstrated over what they define as unfair adjustments in fees in Mukono. UCU dismissed two students and suspended two others for one full academic year over the protest one month later.
Residents protested against legislators move to exempt their allowances from income tax MPs in Kabale.
Police beat some Mubende residents that had paralysed traffic on the Kampala-Fort Portal highway for several hours by putting garbage on the road, protesting against uncollected garbage in the area.
More than 200 boda boda riders stormed the office of Hoima Resident District Commissioner over the release of a robbery suspect.

Students at Bishop Ogez High School in Bushenyi District destroyed property in protest against alleged failure by the school to fulfil a promise after a sport victory. The school was closed for a week and 21 students were expelled after the events.
Residents of Nakalama Sub-county, Iganga district clashed over high yield bean distribution as part of the Operation Wealth Creation Programme.
Makerere University students in Ethics and Human Rights staged a peaceful demonstration near the University main building demanding the reinstatement of their programme.

assoc_actor_2: FDC: Forum for Democratic Change; Government of Uganda (1986-); Journalists (Uganda)
notes: Arrests: Police arrested former FDC presidential candidate Besigye, Kampala Lord mayor, Erias Lukwago, and a Daily Monitor journalist in Kyanamira sub-county in Kabale on their way from Kabale to Runkungiri. Besigye claimed that police broke into their vehicle and sprayed pepper on them. He was detained in Ntungamo.

Police attempted to disperse FDC party supporters that had knelt down on the road at Makanga hill leading to Kabale district by firing in the air, leading to running battle between supporters and police.
A research fellow at Makerere Institute of Social Research (MISR) stripped in public to protest against the Institutes Executive Director. She was later suspended from the school.

Supporters of former FDC presidential candidate Besigye hurled stones at the anti riot police and beat a man wearing a yellow t-shirt in the crowd as they had gathered in Mbarara to see Besigye on his way to Kabale for a Court hearing.

Supporters of former FDC presidential candidate Besigye hurled stones at the anti riot police and beat a man wearing a yellow t-shirt in the crowd as they had gathered in Mbarara to see Besigye on his way to Kabale for a Court hearing.

Gulu University Hoima campus students gathered and uprooted a Kampala International University (KIU) signpost that was erected at their building to protest against the takeover of their buildings by KIU.

Students at Kyambogo University went on a strike over delayed release of grades and transcripts, and the recently concluded disputed guild elections. Police engaged the students in running battles, as the situation had turned out of hand.
Masked men armed with sticks beat people who were following FDC leader Kizza Bezigye along the Kampala road. Police officers at the scene allegedly failed to intervene.
Police arrested and briefly detained 20 FDC supporters in Mbarara Town for blocking traffic on the Buremba road with stones and logs.

assoc_actor_2: HRNJ: Human Rights Network for Journalists
notes: Intruders penetrated and searched the offices of the Human Rights Network for Journalists-Uganda (HRNJ-Uganda) in a series of break-ins targeting offices of Ugandan civil society groups.

Riot students from Makerere University clashed with police over tuition fees. Students carried tree branches and blocked all the university roads with tree logs and burning vehicle tyres, prompting police action to stop the riot, resulting in running battles all over the university campus. Police allegedly used teargas to disperse rioters. Some students face dismissal and a professor was remanded to Luzira prison.

Riot students from Makerere University clashed with police over tuition fees. Students carried tree branches and blocked all the university roads with tree logs and burning vehicle tyres, prompting police action to stop the riot, resulting in running battles all over the university campus. Police allegedly used teargas to disperse rioters. Some students face dismissal and a professor was remanded to Luzira prison.

Riot students from Makerere University clashed with police over tuition fees. Students carried tree branches and blocked all the university roads with tree logs and burning vehicle tyres, prompting police action to stop the riot, resulting in running battles all over the university campus. Police allegedly used teargas to disperse rioters. Some students face dismissal and a professor was remanded to Luzira prison.
Arrests: Police arrested and briefly detained former FDC presidential candidate Besigye in Mulago in Kampala while on his way to the FDC headquarters in Najjanankumbi.
A group of FDC supporters stormed Kira police stations and blocked the road heading to Ntinda following their party leader Besigyes arrest by police.

A group of FDC supporters clashed with police in Nagalama over the arrest of their party leader Besigye. The group were armed with sticks and stones and set up road blocks to access the police station. They were chased by police.

Police blocked hundreds of FDC former presidential candidate supporters on Gayaza road, near Kampala, as they were following their leaders journey to the parties headquarters in Najjanankumbi. Police accused them of vandalising peoples property on their way.
Uganda forces killed at least three suspected Turkana warriors in Kaabong District.
Between four and six people were reportedly killed following fire exchange in Kasese between the official Rwenzuru Palace guards from the Uganda military and the traditional Rwenzururu royal guards.
Police arrested five youths in Kampalas Kisekka market who had chained themselves to electric poles in protest against the Supreme Courts ruling validating President Musevenis reelection.

Police arrested 15 FDC supporters in Mbarara for allegedly holding an unlawful demonstration. The group was reportedly protesting the Supreme Court's decision to dismiss a petition filed by Amama Mbabazi to challenge the February presidential election results.
A mob of riders stoned to death a 20 year old man as they suspected him of being a motorcycle thief in Igorora town in Ibanda district.
Youth in Kampala protested against the Supreme Courts ruling validating President Musevenis reelection. At least 11 were later arrested by police.
Police arrested three youths in Kampalas Katwe Market who had chained themselves to electric poles in protest against the Supreme Courts ruling validating President Musevenis reelection.

assoc_actor_1: FDC: Forum for Democratic Change; Students (Uganda)
notes: A lecturer and students at Makerere University protested the governments continued house-arrest of former FDC presidential candidate Kizza Besigye by marching barefoot. Police officers initially tried to block the demonstrators.
Over 90 head of cattle have been abandoned at Pader district headquarters by over 200 residents of Barajwa village in a protest over invasion of unfamiliar pastoralists grazing on their land.

Police clashed with FDC women league members at former FDC presidential candidate Besigyes residence in Kisangati using batons and pepper spray. Some of the women sustained bruises from the falling as they engaged with police for about about two hours. One of the women was arrested by police in the scuffle.
Unidentified gunmen exchanged fire with police officers guarding Bukwo Central Police Station in Kapchorwa. Police called UPDF soldiers for reinforcement, forcing the attackers to retreat.

A group of 72 people from Rukungiri district who was headed to former FDC presidential candidate Besigyes residence at Kasangati attempted to demonstrate against police blocking their way near the candidates residence, setting car tyres on fire in the middle of the road and distracting traffic flow. Police moved swiftly to quell the rioters and forced the group to drive back to Kampala.
Lira residents protested against deterioriating security in their district since the presidential elections last month.
Workers at Kagadi Hospital in Kibale district staged a sit down strike over alleged delayed payments for their services.

A group of 100 riders stormed Bugamba police post in Rwampara and destroyed documents in an effort to take out two suspects who had been detained on allegation of stealing a motorcycle. Police responded by shooting bullets in the air, killing one and injuring another.
Police shot and injured a person reportedly pelting stones at security officers in Bundibugyo.

Eight were killed in fresh clashes that broke out between the Bakonzo and Bamba in Kitere village in Ntoroko sub-county in Bundibugyo district. Two of the Bakonzo were killed by police when they tried to attack the Bamba.

Unidentified group attack Kidodo police station near Kasese. The attack leaves two people dead.T he attack on Kidodo police post comes just after tribal clashes between the Bamba and Bakonzo in Bundibugyo left eight people dead.

Up to eight people were killed, including two on the night of 22 March, by unidentified attackers in what is believed to be linked to tribal clashes between the Bamba and Bakonzo communities in Bundibugyo.

FDC supporters protested against the transfer of the case filed by Besigye against police deployment at his house to the High Court under unclear circumstances. They engaged in running battles with the police.
A student was reportedly killed by unidentified residents around a school in Kabale during a violent student strike.

FDC protesters were dispersed by anti-riot police in Luwero as they were converging for Free my vote campaign prayers in protest of the outcome of the February 18 presidential election and the subsequent home detention of their parties leader Besigye.
Police and UPDF officers shot dead four people who were reportedly trying to grab guns from them while on patrol in Kasese district. One officer was also injured.

Clashes between a group of more than 60 gunmen alleged to be members of the royal guard for the Rwenzururu kingdom and UPDF soldiers on night foot patrol in Hima town council killed two people and critically injured four soldiers. The clashes are believed to have been triggered by the sub-county elections, which saw the NRM candidate win.
Police fired tear-gas in Hima to disperse crowds that had started burning houses in protest of the local chief bye-election results that saw the ruling NRM candidate win.

Police fired teargas to disperse a group of men armed with sticks stormed Bunyere polling station in Lwengo demanding its closure. The men claimed to be agents of Joseph Kiyimba, an independent candidate for the Kisekka Sub County.
Arrests: The chief campaigner for former FDC presidential candidate Kizza Besigye in Rukungiri District was arrested and detained at Ntungamo Police Station.
A hand grenade was dumped at the gate of the sister of the Chairman of the Independent Electoral Commission by unidentified people in Kagoma Maganjo in Wakiso district
Gunmen overrun Kapchorwa Central Police Station, killing three policemen and injuring another on duty. The violence was claimed by a group calling itself the Uganda Saving Force.
One person was arrested in Luwero as youth councilor polls turned chaotic

actor1: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Special Forces Command
notes: Two Democratic Party supporters were shot at by Special Forces Command (SFC) soldiers in Entebbe Municipality as they protected a journalist who was being attacked by supporters of the ruling party at a polling station.

assoc_actor_2: FDC: Forum for Democratic Change; Journalists (Uganda)
notes: Eight people, including a radio journalist, were injured as Military Police battled FDC supporters who wanted to raid a state-owned radio station, which they alleged was broadcasting false results in favour of NRM candidate for the mayoral race.
Kabale residents pitched camp at police station over the arrest of two polling agents
Policemen overseeing Western youth parliamentary polls in Fort Portal fired teargas after a Lieutenant-General and a group of 25 youth tried to use force to enter a tally centre.
Delegates of the Regional Electoral Commission in Masaka protested over allowances

assoc_actor_2: FDC: Forum for Democratic Change; Journalists (Uganda)
notes: Arrests: Police arrested FDC opposition candidate Besigye as he attempted to leave his home in Kasangati, Wakiso district. Six journalists were also arrested over allegations of inciting violence.

Up to ten people were killed, four injured and 80 arrested in Bundibugyo post-election violence involving unidentified groups. Up to 100,000 people fled violence in the district. The violence allegedly stemmed from the declaration of the National Resistance Movement (NRM) party candidate Ronald Mutegeki as the winner of the hotly contested LCV chairmanship race against independent candidate Jolly Tibemanya.
Arrests: Police briefly arrested and detained six journalists at the home of opposition FDC candidate Besigye in Kasangati, Wakiso District
Arrests: Police allegedly arrested and detained over 200 opposition FDC figures across Uganda.
Arrests: Police arrested FDC opposition candidate Besigye as he attempted to leave his home in Kasangati, Wakiso district to protest against presidential election results.
Unidentified attackers set fire to over 30 grass-thatched huts in Mbale district, believed to be for ruling party NRM supporters. 20 people were injured in the process and property destroyed.
Arrests: Police in Mbarara town raided the opposition FDC party offices followed information that they were planning to carry out an attack on the town and arrested at least 45 FDC supporters
Arrests:Police arrested FDC opposition candidate Besigye as he attempted to leave his home in Kasangati, Wakiso district to protest against presidential election results.

assoc_actor_2: FDC: Forum for Democratic Change; Journalists (International)
notes: Arrests: Police arrested FDC opposition candidate Besigye as he attempted to leave his home in Kasangati, Wakiso district to go to the Electoral Commission head office to protest the elections results. Police peppersprayed at least two international journalists while taking pictures of police arresting FDC opposition candidate Besigye at his residence in Wakiso District. Other journalists were blocked from accessing the news scene.

Suspected FDC supporters attacked a just elected NRM woman MP for Bugiri District, smashing the windscreen of her personal car before pelting stones at her home in Muyenga Zone of Bugiri town. They then engaged the police in a series of running battles in town. One person was shot and injured during the skirmishes.
At least 10 people were arrested as protesters blocked roads and burnt tyres at Kisekka Market and Bwaise, a Kampala suburb, in protest of a police raid on the FDC office headquarters the same day.
At least 10 people were arrested as protesters blocked roads and burnt tyres at Kisekka Market and Bwaise, a Kampala suburb, in protest of a police raid on the FDC office headquarters the same day.
Police clashed with FDC supporters in Najjanankumbi in southern Kampala following the arrest of their leader, firing tear gas to disperse them. Several people were injured.
Angry voters in Nakigalala beat up a polling agent for the Busiro South NRM candidate whom they accused of ballot stuffing. He managed to escape by shooting in the air.
Police fired tear gas to disperse voters in Kampala angered about delays in the delivery of polling materials on polling day.

actor2: Police Forces of Uganda (1986-) Prison Guards
notes: Prison guards opened fire on inmates who attempted to escape, killing one and severely injuring two. Over 183 inmates reportedly demanded to be set free after predicting that FDC candidate Besigye could win the election. They then started rioting.
An explosive device killed three pupils in Mengo, a Kampala suburb, and left at least six others in critical condition.
Arrests:Police arrested and briefly detained FDC presidential candidate Kizza Besigye in Kampala on different occasions.

Police blocked the vehicle of FDC presidential candidate Kizza Besigye as he tried to hold a rally in Wandegeya area of Kampala. Police fired flash bombs, tear gas and rubber bullets at angry supporters who had rallied around their candidate and began throwing stones. At least one person was confirmed killed in the clashes and several people injured and arrested.
Five supporters of the ruling NRM candidate for Mawokota South Constituency allegedly assaulted supporters from a rival camp on 13 February, causing several injuries. They were arrested the next day.
An Indian national was attacked and severely injured by a procession escorting a political candidate on February 13 near Kitgum House in Makindye as their procession moved from Nakawa into Kampala.
NRM member Muhabwa was allegedly kidnapped in Kibinge Sub County. He had earlier attended a campaign rally by the Democratic Party parliamentary candidate Kiyingi.
Over 300 people staged a demonstration around Kamuswagas palace in Rakai district to protest the manner in which their chief was arrested.
Youth under the association of Youth Liberation Front (YLF) have stormed Buganda Road court in protest of the delayed ruling in the case of battered WBS Journalist Andrew Lwanga

assoc_actor_1: NRM: National Resistance Movement; Police Forces of Uganda (1986-)
notes: 3 children were killed in a stampede in one of President Museveni's rallies in Kiziba, Rakai district.
People in Hoima protested delayed road works in the municipality.
The arrest of Kamuswaga in Masaka drew angry reactions from his loyalists. A group stormed Masaka police station to protest the manner in which he was arrested.

A crime preventer in Rakai district is nursing injuries he sustained in an attack by eight suspected vigilantes on 2 February. Residents managed to apprehend one of the vigilantes and beat him up in retaliation

A crime preventer in Rakai district is nursing injuries he sustained in an attack by eight suspected vigilantes on 2 February. Residents managed to apprehend one of the vigilantes and beat him up in retaliation

assoc_actor_1: NRM: National Resistance Movement; Police Forces of Uganda (1986-)
assoc_actor_2: NRM: National Resistance Movement; Police Forces of Uganda (1986-)
notes: Clashes between NRM supporters ahead of a rally by Musevini in Lwemiyaga. Police fired tear gas to disperse them.

Arrests: Military forces arrested former military general Sejusa on 31 January in Kampala, ahead of presidential elections. He was remanded to Luzira prison on 2 February and charged with insubordination, participating in political party activities and being absent without leave.
Police fired tear gas in Igorora, Ibanda district, to disperse a crowd that had gathered after the official campaign deadline of 6pm and asked FDC presidential candidate Besigye to 'greet' them

Hundreds of residents of Bulawula and Nakaseta villages decided to set up bonfires and raise barricades to protest against the poor state of the Luweero-Nakaseke road. Anti-riot police fired teargas to break up the demonstration.
More than 200 unemployed youths stormed the offices of the firm, Sinohydro, the Chinese company building the 600MW Karuma power dam, expressing their plight of being unemployed.
Six residents of Ruhinda County in Mitooma district are nursing injuries following violent clashes involving supporters of rival candidates of the ruling NRM party.

A resident of a village in Rugando sub-county claims that NRM supporters broke into residents houses and assaulted them. According to Francis, two of his daughters sustained injuries on the head and legs and are currently admitted at Bugamba Health Center IV.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: FDLR rebels have allegedly kidnapped five Ugandans for ransom in the course of the month of January. Location of kidnapping unknown, though likely near the border with Rwanda.
NRM supporters, rooting for two different candidates, were involved in skirmishes. Several people were injured when supporters moved in to prevent his vehicle from being set ablaze.
A demonstration allegadly took place by unemployed youth on 12th January in Kampala.
A reporter was reportedly assaulted by a Ugandan police officer in Kampala while covering a demonstration by a group of unemployed youth.
A journalist was severely beaten by police while covering a procession by the Unemployed Youths of Uganda (UAU), to the police headquarters in Naguru.
Police have used teargas and sticks to disperse rioting residents in Kasiiso trading center in Butuntumula Sub County in Luweero district.

Ali Lubuuka Golooba, a journalist with Buddu FM in Masaka is nursing injuries he sustained in an attack by suspected body guards of Muhammad Muyanja Mbabaali, the Bukoto South NRM parliamentary candidate in Lwengo district.
Two suspected Turkana warriors have died in a gunfire exchange with Uganda Peoples Defense Forces in Kaabong district.

More than 100 people in Wamulongo village in Mpungwe Sub County in Mayuge district are out in the cold after their houses were set ablaze by angry residents to avenge the killing of 38-year old Zedekiya Mwesigwa
Police used tear gas to disperse cyclists who were protesting the payment of annual fees for their operations in Lira municipality.
Police were forced to use live ammunition to breakup a scuffle between supporters to two local candidates. A car was damaged and several houses burnt in the ensuing violence.

Several people sustained injuries following an unidentified gangs attack on Forum for Democratic Change (FDC) supporters near the Toriet IDP Camp in Bukwo district, where FDC presidential candidate Besigye was about to address locals. Police rushed to intervene with teargas and live bullets.
Two people were injured as police clashed with Forum for Democratic Change (FDC) presidential candidate Besigyes supporters on 6 January in Mbale.
Detonate/Dismantle:A bomb was discovered at Gulu taxi park and later detonated by police. People were evacuated from the scene. The source of the bomb is unknown.

actor2: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Presidential Security Unit
notes: The State Minister of Economic Monitoring Henry Banyenzaki went into a fight with President Museveni's security guard at an NRM rally in Kacherere Parish, Bufundi sub-county in Rubanda West.
FIghting ensued between two NRM political candidates at an NRM rally in Kacherere Parish, Bufundi sub-county in Rubanda West. Security forces had to intervene.

Arrests: Police arrested The Democratic Alliance (TDA)s campaigns coordinator on 29 December outside Ntungamo grade one magistrate court. He was accused of having assaulted opposition supporters during the 13 December clashes between NRM and TDA supporters in Ntungamo Municipality

actor1: Police Forces of Uganda (1986-) Prison Guards
notes: An inmate at Lugore Prison in Palaro Sub-county, Gulu District, was allegedly tortured by 10 prison guards on the orders of the deputy officer in charge of the facility after speaking out on brutality against inmates at the prison on 28 December 2015.

Police fired live bullets and teargas on independent candidate Amama Mbabazis supporters as he attempted to address a rally in Dokolo Town after the mandatory time to end campaign rallies. Several people sustained injuries.

Chaos ensued between National Resistance Movement (NRM) and Forum for Democratic Change (FDC) supporters as the formers deputy speaker was accused of organising a gathering at the same time and venue FDCs candidate Besigye was supposed to hold his campaign rally (Lalogi Sub-county in Gulu District).

assoc_actor_1: NRM: National Resistance Movement; FDC: Forum for Democratic Change
notes: Two journalists came under attack as chaos broke out in Lalogi Sub-county in Gulu District between National Resistance Movement (NRM) and Forum for Democratic Change (FDC) supporters.
